description: We wandered into this place after a long night out and was not disappointed. As a matter of fact we came back twice before leaving the city from a long weekend. I loved the atmosphere! It is definitely one of those neighborhood bars where everybody knows your name. Small, dim, great drinks and friendly people. Will come back for sure!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Six of us ended up at Aces on a Saturday afternoon, and we had a blast!  They had the perfect table for 6, we had lots of drinks and played "Cards Against Humanity" for a couple of hours.  So much fun!

A cool atmosphere, great staff, and a poster of a painting from "Goodfellas" all came together to make for the perfect Saturday afternoon. 
.
Try the house specialty "Koo-koo Juice."  When I asked what was in it, the bartender replied, "You don't need to know!"  It was tasty and a bit strong, but then again, I'm naturally koo-koo.
author: kimber o.

description:
Super divey spot with fairly cheap drinks.

I would have loved to give more stars but somewhat rude service and cash bring it to a 3. The bartender could stand to crack a smile once in a while!

It was my husband's birthday. He wanted to bring the cool plastic cup out but he yelled for us to bring it back. He did rinse the cup and return it afterward, but he also loudly (and rudely) kept talking about what we did wrong our entire way out.

There were a few TV screens, seats at the bar, and along the large windows so you can get fresh air and people watch.

I suppose if you like divey bars and don't need friendly or smiling service, this place is fine.
author: Ivy C.

description: Super cool little divey sports bar with music and reasonably priced drinks. Tall cans of bud light are $3. Add a shot of Jameson and the total is $9. Not bad even for so called " five bars" in the city.  The bartenders are nice and attentive.  There's a good mixed crown so pretty much anyone that's not a jerk should feel comfortable here.
author: Ondrea B.

description: Good selection of drinks and great bar staff. It was unfortunately that the day I was here there was a loud obnoxious group making a huge scene. Otherwise I would imagine this is a great place to grab a beer and watch the game. The price of beer is really good too.
author: Liz M.

description:
If I could give it 0 stars i would, bar is only a couple feet from our hotel, soon as we walked in he asked for ID's  took a quick glance and gave it back saying they were no good.... we're in our mid 20's and treated us like underaged kids trying to get in, only to go back to the group of locals playing  bingo. Was super rude told us to leave and had one of his locals sitting at the bar mocking us to go as well. Obviously does not know how to check ID's thank you for ruining our experience within a couple minutes of being an In establishment.  

Gotta love having people assume your ethnicity while they're obviously drunk, (2 latinas, and a white girl FYI shows how much of a racist you are) aces bar you've gone to an all new low having one of your locals comment on my review saying he saw "our frightened Chinese faces" while it was dim as hell smgdh ‍ saying you saw us pull out our "credentials" doesn't mean you took a look at them, I'm a bartender/server FYI and being so you OBVIOUSLY have to understand and know that every gosh damn state has different ID's just cause they don't look like the ones from California doesn't mean they're fake being so one was from Arizona and just in case you didn't know I'll drop this off here as well 

P.S a Scooby snack is coconut rum, midori, pineapple juice and whip cream cause apparently you guys have no clue what it is.

ARIZONA: Licenses expire on the 65th birthday, and until then drivers only need new photos every 12 years -- making Arizona unique in how long a license can last
author: Brenda M.

description:
Super fun bar. Not as divey as others have painted it to be. Came for the specials and left with a pretty good buzz going. I really like this place. knowledgeable staff and not too bad to look at. 

We ordered a shot and a beer each. The Bartender came back and gave us a try of their Irish blended ice coffee. It was pretty damn strong. Definitely yummy. 

I'll be back for some shots next week.
author: Kat D.

description: The best crew of bartenders in the city. All of the guys are pros. The croud can be a bit eclectic so, at times, the crew needs to impose a little order to keep things running smoothly. Kollin is the king. But they all are distinct and good at their craft in their own ways. Drinks are strong and it's a great spot for sports. They pull off the New York theme well. It opens at 6:00am. It's worth checking it out at that hour for a San Francisco experience.
author: Harland K.

description:
So grateful for this place. Every year it gets more special. Jake is a living legend. The locals are barely tolerable, and beautiful for it. The Gold Dust may be dead, but Ace's is still Ace's and I hope it always remains so. It's the Triple Lindy of Dives.

When I'm having a lousy morning, there's only one place I know will make it better. In fact, it never fails.

Viva Les Aces!
author: Mitch H.

description: Sweet, friendly guys. Nice divey bar. Good selection of drinks. It's the go to bar I've been looking for. Will definitely be back.
author: Tez N.

description:
The thing I hate most about Jake is that he always forgets the horse I rode in on.

The horse isn't happy about it either.
author: John B.

description: Had a beer at NY Giants headquarters in San Francisco! Fun atmosphere and great prices!!
author: Patricia M.

description: I'm not a New York sports fan, but I can appreciate a good deal and fun bar. Ace's has great drink specials, and the bartenders are friendly. My boyfriend is a Yankees fan (sigh) so he wanted to get a look at the Yankee stadium seats, so it was a nice touch for him!
author: Sarah B.

description: Nice n' divey sports bar. Seriously, this is a unique combination of the two and I will definitely be coming back. Not sure if their bingo night is for me, but I'll happily drink here while watching the nba playoffs.
author: Eric S.

description: It was tough to find a bar open during the day. So happy to  have found this place. Super friendly service. Reasonably priced drinks. Everyone was friendly.
author: Joey H.

description: Great place! We were just visiting and were welcomed with open arms!  Great social place for visitors!
author: Elle G.

description:
Oh man, the best bar ever besides Hara. 
The owner is incredibly sweet, the people the all work there are the funniest/nicest staff you could meet. This is right next to my house and has become a consistent stop for my dog and I to hang out at. 
My dog is continuously being fed treats and I get nice and drunk, it works for both of us. 
Make sure to go when the bartender Adam is working, he is the best and also adorable.
author: Sari S.

description: A little grimey, a little gritty, a little sticky - just my kind of dive. NYC memorabilia and reminders everywhere, even in the toilet, which honestly is filthy, but again, it's a dive. First off, can I just say, real stadium seats from Shea and Yankee stadiums?? AWESOME. Now, you won't get much in the way of ambiance here. The seats are sticky, and the toilet reeks, but you will get really friendly bartenders and cheap drinks ($4 BJ special - shot of Jameson and a Bud Light). You'll also get some great vintage posters and rowdy patrons all around you, but meh. Buy a bunch of cheap drinks, play some Connect Four, and enjoy yourself. They also have a jukebox and some damn good music playing here all the time. Will be back to sit in those seats again to watch a game or five.
author: Danny C.

description:
Sunday football review right here, so don't roll up on a Tuesday at 9pm and expect the same experience. That being said... I love this bar. And yes, I'm from NY. And yes, I came to watch a NYG/NYJ game. Feel free to call me biased, bc I totally am. SF is a bit foreign to me so when I can find a bar that feels like home, I'm a happy man. There's an overall divey feel here and it seems like you can both get your drink on with a crew or roll up solo and still have a good time. There are a ton of 24/7 drink specials and then also specific Sunday specials. Word is on nicer days there's a BBQ with meats being passed around free of charge, but I can't confirm that firsthand. Either way, perfect place to come to watch NY sports while in the bay area. 

Bonus points: you can drink in a pair of seats from the old Yankee Stadium
author: Drew A.

description: Great place to watch NFL games and great beer specials!   This is a NY Sports Bar (NY Giants - not Jets) and a great place to meet up with other NY'ers!
author: Richard H.

description: Good local place. Kookoo juice was a nice surprise. Drinks were good and reasonable. Staff was friendly.
author: dana p.

description:
Screw this place.  I'm a huge NY Giant football fan, love watching the games with other G Men fans and this is a NY bar.  Well, listen pal, I'm from NY and New Yorkers are the most hospitable people in the world.  Maybe the Staff at Aces should go on a road trip to pick up pointers.  Crap attitudes, unfriendly, slow as fuck behind the bar, dirty and extremely unwelcoming.  I will find another G men bar for this places sucks.

I have zero positive comment for this dive.
author: Rusty G.

description: Jesus Christmas christ where do I start, between Trevor's knowledge  on all sports and sf culture and the trash pandas ((raccoons)) up the street you cannot go wrong!!!! The fernet shot as a way of passage was the worst/best thing ever. One day I will come back here and win the chilli cook-off or maybe do the wire to wire challenge. I love you ace bar and that is something.
author: Erin S.

description:
I mean it's Ace's why bother writing a review?

However it's my favorite bar in the city to grab an $11 budlight bucket of beer and cure a hangover with a Bloody Mary at 9:30 am on game day. 

The place can get pretty crowded for bigger NY Giants match ups.

They pipe the game cast over the speakers and at half time it's always throwback Big Pun and Notorious BIG blasting over the speakers. 

It's a great place to meet relocated New York transplants and has a special place in my heart for pretty much making Sunday's worth scrambling to get dressed and into a cab to get a good spot to sit and watch the NY Giants. 

They allow you to bring in food so it's always great to run and get sandwiches or pizza during halftime. 

Ace's is easily one of my favorite bars in any city.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Great people on both sides of the bar & plenty of screens to watch the football!
Cheers heaps guys :D
author: Ad R.

description:
This is a NY themed bar. I liked visiting New York, it was a lot of fun. The decor here was all NY stuff so that was pretty cool.

Just a few notes:
- $20 minimum for credit cards

- Bartender was very nice, allowed us to bring chips to snack on because he said they (do not?) or were not serving food.

- Drinks are affordable, which can make hitting the 20 dollar minimum difficult.

- The table in the corner (the one behind the stadium seats) is a bit awkward because the top half of the door is kept open and can easily hit a patron.

- Bartender did not know how to make a Tom Collins, looked it up, and still made it incorrectly. Lime and Cherry garnish please. When I asked for lime, he squeezed a lemon in my drink and put it there. Needs the lime still.

Overall, just a so-so bar to go to. Vibes were chill, decor was cool, drinks were average. Nothing spectacular really. Nothing stood out. 

It's in a pretty sketchy neighborhood, so just keep that in mind. I wouldn't recommend this place, and I won't seek out coming here, but it's possible that i'll be back if some friends wanted to go here.

**Don't know why some people say this isn't a dive bar. It could be. "A dive bar is an informal bar or pub. Such bars are sometimes referred to as neighborhood bars, where local residents gather to drink and socialize." It's as much a sports bar as a dive bar IMO.
author: Kaje Y.

description:
I was trying to figure out where I could see the World Hockey Championships gold medal game (Finland - Canada) last Sunday morning. Once I realized I couldn't catch it at my local bar,  I called Ace's, thinking there was a good chance they show it.

As soon as someone picked up the call, I hear "No. We are NOT showing the Finland - Canada hockey game!" I busted out laughing, and asked: "How did you know I'm calling about it!!?" The guy says "Well, I have 1, 2, 3, 4, ..wait,, 12 or 15 people watching the game here at their laptops." This sounded like a better than nothing plan to me, so I headed over.

Once I made it to the bar a few minutes later, the game was already on the big TV screen, with a bunch of fellow Finns gathered to drink beer and slowly witness Canada kick our butt.. :-/ 

But I couldn't have thought of a better set-up and more chill an environment to see the game! The staff was so nice to make this happen for us, and were 100% welcoming towards our Finnish group of hockey fans. 

You rock! Thank you - I will definitely be back!
author: Anja H.

description: Fun neighborhood bar. Located on Sutter and Hyde. A friendly warm environment where everybody knows each other. A place where you can always find a friend. There is a great grocery store next door and many food options close by. Parking is not that easy but if you circle around a few times you are sure to find a spot. They are known for their east coast vibe and party buses, not to mention the occasional barbecues they have.
author: J J.

description: Haven't been in this bar for many years. It's a great dive bar very friendly The young cute and gregarious bartender Ray was playing great music the only flaw is the bathroom is dirty. Otherwise I'll be back!
author: SF T.

description:
Is it loud and crowded and full of folks watching sports? Absolutely. 
Was it amazing to be miles and miles from home but to walk into a bar full of fellow Badger fans to watch the first game of the season? Youbetcha. 
Sure, the Badgers lost, but the comeraderie and the knowledge that LSU didn't have anything like that happening in the Bay area was good enough for me.
author: Nicole H.

description:
The new keg table at Ace's is a must try when getting a group together to watch a game!

I recently reserved the keg table for a few of the Giants World Series games, inviting 15-20 friends to join the party.  To start, the Aces staff was great, ensuring our area is reserved and roped off, had cups, pitchers of water, etc.  

Depending on your group size, Aces can definitely accommodate....whether it's just booking the keg table area, adding on the four stadium seats (2 Yankee & 2 Shea Stadium seats), or even adding the large round table with seating for ~10.  You're then able to pick the right keg size (5 gallon, 7.75 gallon, 15.5 gallon) for your group and the kind of beer you'd like to consume.

Not only do you have your own area to hangout, drink and watch the game with your friends......but, during those busy sporting events (like the World Series), your group does not have to worry about battling the crowd for a beer, and can instead pour an ice cold beer straight from the tap.  Add on a few delivery pizza's and your night is complete :)

This is definitely a new and unique way to watch a game with friends and I would highly recommend it to others!
author: Kevin M.

description:
If you are a Football Giants fan, then Ace's the place. Not so much Baseball Giants, as this bar is New York in heart - and seat, with the most noticeable feature is four Yankee Stadium seats with their own bar top and view of a tv.

If you aren't any of these things, than Ace's is just a great dive bar with plenty of TVs and $6 drink specials. I got the invite to watch the USA-Portugal match, and the place was packed but not overflowing. The atmosphere was very positive. Though the single bartender seemed a bit swamped, he was doing a great job keeping drinks flowing.

So if looking for a cheap place to watch a game on the weekend, I can recommend this place.
author: Michael C.

description:
A legit neighborhood bar with reasonable prices and fast service. The place can get loud on a football afternoon but that is part of the fun. 

It is a New York bar, so if any NY teams are on you will find them on the TVs. Also, it is a Wisconsin bar so if the Badgers are playing on a Saturday in the fall or in March Madness, swing in for drink specials during the game.
author: Erik H.

description:
Awesome little NY Bar. 

One of the owners is from Boston otherwise i wouldnt step a fucking foot in this place... Haha just kidding. 

All the staff that works here is awesome and super friendly. 

I will keep on coming back. 

GO SOX!
author: Matthew M.

description: Stopped in for a couple drinks to cool down and kill time. Glad I did. Though I care little for sports, as this place has five (5) TVs  pimping games, it is a comfortable dive with a friendly crowd. Plus, my girl Stella is on the menu.
author: Frank L.

description: This place rules. Can't wait for new years day to watch the Giants beat the god damn Redskins.
author: Helmut R.

description: This is a cool, local dive bar that has NY roots so be prepared for that. Good place to hang if you are staying nearby or stop in for a nightcap after a concert walking back to hotel. (That was a long night!) the bartenders were nice every tin we were there and the place definitely has a local crowd, but if you are nice enough they are nice to you.
author: Mary S.

description:
Before writing the review about Ace's a bit about the neighborhood should be mentioned. Walking alone is not advised, especially if you are walking alone at night from the SOMA/Market St. area up Hyde, Leavenworth, or Jones streets (those aren't the only ones, just the ones that come to mind). This area is notoriously known as the Tenderloin!

It can get pretty hairy. If you decide to hoof it, make sure to look down at the sidewalk -  you will be dodging a plethora of flotsam and jetsam. Items witnessed that come to mind: animal poop, human poop, urine, vomit, blood, lipids, used condoms, needles, clothes/underwear scattered about haphazardly, horizontal bodies (dead or alive, your guess is as good as mine).

Aces is a seedy, gritty NYC-style dive bar that has seen more than a fair amount of rage in the past judging by the alcohol-stained walls and floors that make a sharp tearing sound when one attempts to pull their foot off the flypaper-like floor. The bathrooms are a gem too - I uploaded a pic that hangs on the wall of one of the bathrooms. I think it does more justice than any description I could provide.

My first time there was to watch a NY Giants game. Picture a scene from Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome - a hundred bodies packed in like sardines, teaming while pressed one on top of the other, witnessing the brutality of football, while chugging down buckets of Budweiser (5 cans to a bucket for 12 buckaroos!) and dancing around like aborigines when their team goes for the kill. 

A handful of mounted fans are the only climate control that keeps the angry mob from going off the reservation and starting a bread riot! I loved every minute of this crescendo of thunderous drunken exuberance!

The bartenders take no prisoners. They are always hustling, interacting with the patrons, will skip over you if you aren't prepared to order. You'll get your beverages quick enough, if you can navigate past the 4 layers of bodies without lubricant. Tip: if you are looking for food, you came to the wrong place, they don't serve any here.

As the Terminator said, "I'll be back!"
author: Jason M.

description: A New York bar, nothing fancy, no annoying music, bartenders are down to earth, and the frozen Irish coffees are great. I love that huge open window they have, at a small bar like that it makes the room feel much bigger than it really is.
author: Lincy S.

description:
Love this bar! Awesome prices and never over crowed.
The staff is super friendly and there are always good people there to start a conversation with.
author: Cescilia A.

description: One of my favorite bars in San Francisco! An awesome dive with amazing bartenders. I especially love that this is also a Wisconsin Badger bar and game days are insane! I highly recommend it!
author: Janelle S.

description: Decent place to grab a brew, bartender was nice enough. We were waiting for our friend to get out of the hospital so this was right down the street. Apparently you can buy a keg here and share it with your friends??? We made plans to come back. They also have many sports programs playing and a few board games.
author: Alyssa J.

description:
I always enjoy a bar that opens at 6 AM.  I was pleasantly surprised that this joint was just a half a block away from my hotel.  I enjoyed two nights there watching the World Series.  The place is dark, the bud light is cheap, friendly bartenders, cool people watching from the window.
Stop on by and have a cold one!!!
author: Erick R.

description: Best bar, best owners in town. They've sponsored my softball team for years, I know these guys well. Ace's is THE best spot to catch a game. Hands down.
author: Daniel D.

description:
I met up with an old event partner and we decided to go to Ace's for a few drinks and catch up and hear the latest.  It was a Giant's game day and I'm glad I arrived a little earlier to save us some seats.

They've got a pretty good happy hour but it only applies to well drinks and Bud cans.  I was in the mood for a snakebite (regularly priced), which game in a 20 oz size.  They used a non-Wyder's cider which was fine, and a single sip helped to whet my palate.

The bartenders here are pretty friendly and Ace's is a dog-friendly bar.  That means they're welcome inside to enjoy the game with you and your buddies.  Just be careful that they don't get stepped on because it can get kind of crowded in here.

Food: n/a

Service: 7/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description: Best place to come for a chill night or a pregame. Quality bartenders who know their stuff when it comes to great cocktails.
author: Andrea F.

description:
Great to watch sports! Went to watch a European cup soccer match! Bartender was super accommodating - turned on volume etc.
Dive bar atmosphere - what you want when sports is on tv!!
Bud $3!

Good spot for sports and beer!
author: Daniel S.

description: I was told by the bartender I couldn't use the main bathroom which is not only a single stall it is marked by both men and women sign, when I pointed that out he said not to argue with him and it was the men's room.
author: Tara A.

description: It's been a while since I've visited Aces.... the frozen Irish coffees are as I remembered strong and delicious.  What really caught my eye was the new addition of Trevor as day bartender! Not only did he make feel welcome but helped me learn the rules of dice while I took his $$$ round after round.  Super fun bar can't wait to revisit!!!
author: Molly A.

description: Man, I could ramble, but the bottom line is these shitheads are the best and their bar is the tops. Friendly, quick with a joke or to light up your smoke, and idiots. It's the perfect San Francisco transplant combination.
author: Justin H.

description: Love this bar. Friendly staff, great drinks, simple good fun. Don't expect fancy anything or food or anything that you wouldn't get in a good new York dive bar.  Perfect in every way.
author: Matt C.

description:
Ace's seems like the perfect place to roll into when you've had (more than) a few too many. It's a bit divey and low key, filled with fairly friendly bartenders, plenty of regulars and cheap drinks. There are also a handful of TV's if you fancy catching a game.

While there are some chairs to belly up to the bar, try to score one of the giant booths off to the left. You could easily host a sizeable poker game at those mammoth booths. And hey, I award extra points for a clean bathroom. Thanks, Ace's.
author: Nicole W.

description:
What better way to kick off the Halloween weekend than meeting up with friends for a pre-holiday DYL party at Ace's. Kristina always knows how to pick them and that's why I come back for more. 

The drinks were nice and cheap. Special of the night was Sailor Jerry Cocktails, which I added Diet Coke. Low on the Calories and only $3.  

I had a great time mixing it up with my friends and meeting new people. You can meet a lot of friendly folks dressed up like Wonder Woman, but I think it's not even the superpowers - it's just a friendly local bar.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Dawg, this bar is so dope! Where else is it lit at 7-8am? Gotta love your good old dive bar, as I've grown to appreciate as I've gotten older opposed to those wanna be fancy clubs full top tier douchebags. The older gentleman behind the bar, you can truly tell he loves his job which is rare to come across nowadays.
author: Jorge P.

description:
It's a GIANTS bar! of course I will give it 5 stars.

Nothing fancy, very New Yorky, kinda like a bar you would find in the East Village. There are enough TVs in the small room so you have a good view anywhere you are.

The bartenders are great! Fast, Friendly, Cool.
author: Rico R.

description:
This past Sunday, my girlfriends and I were on our way to brunch. Walking so far it was time to use the restroom. We had stopped at Ace's and JLUKE was kind enough to let us in. If you are from SF then you know how hard it is to find a restroom, let alone someone kind enough to use it without a purchase.

After brunch we decided to go back to Ace's and have a beer. JLUKE was the best bartender. Not only was the service great but he also gave us the history behind the bar and the story. He recommended this amazing Irish Coffee that is still on my mind because it was so delicious. We also got a few really cool shirts. 

Thank you JLUKE for your hospitality and welcoming good energy. He gets 5 stars, overall I gave it a 4. 

Cheers!
author: Alicia D.

description:
Im excited to say that I just found my home away from home!!!! I used to have my fav bar on Polk St. But since everything is changing, businesses trying to cater to the Tech Folk, I felt that it was time to break up with Polk St and find a new spot.

I stumbled upon Aces. This place is amazing. You go to this place and it feels like an episode of Cheers. Everyone is super friendly and they make you feel like family. it's full of character. A lot of photos of friends, family, and coworkers on the walls. The regulars sit on the "Hyde St" side of the bar. 

I go in on Saturdays most of the time to visit the two Saturday Night bartenders Tommy and Jason. Not only do they make great, yet fast drinks, they're fun to talk to and not bad to look at either. Try Aces Irish Coffee slushy. They're pretty addicting and comes in a cool cup.
author: Kaylie P.

description:
The vibe in here is super chillaxed and all about the football games. Every team is welcome, it's a melting pot of many fans with all games playing - but if you're a NY Giants fan then you're in for a treat. 

It's a NY Giants bar - Nuff said !!
author: Sabrina J.

description: No wonder they were empty on a Saturday night at 9 pm. I'm talking dead. A group of us went in to use the restroom (3 adult woman)  before we could finish they were pounding on door to get out and yelling. When we came out they had stuck s camera in our face and some broad also got in our face. I was shocked as I planned on buying rounds of shots for us girls as we had a hour to kill before an event two buildings down. I am disgusted at how we were treated. They literally lost out on hundreds from us that night. Lesson learned... Don't go into a empty bar. Horrible attitudes
author: Amanda P.

description: Great for football games on TV and beer!!
author: John P.

description:
Bars like this are the reason it's so easy to be lush-tastic here in San Francisco. It's combination of cheap drinks, insane hours (I think they're closed 3-4 hours a day), and proximity. Killer combo!

The usual Tendernob denizens, Cheerslike regulars, and legendary characters haunt this dimly lit space. Did I mention the free dogs and burgers they provide on certain game days?

I love that bursting into song with the whole bar singing (Think: Manly musicals) is not an uncommon event.

It's a comfy, cozy sports dive that you can easily slip into like a worn pair of jeans. Don't expect more than it is and you'll have a good night.
author: Jess C.

description:
Alright, we were in San Fran for the first Giants game of the season so I found out about Aces.  It's the only NY bar in the city.

It was one of the liveliest bars I had ever been to.  It took me a a few minutes to get adjusted and just enjoy it for what it was (a ton of passionate and loud Giants fans).  With that said, they have awesome drink specials including buckets of tall boys for 12 bucks!  They also had a grill outside and were barbequing and kinds of stuff and bringing it in to the bar for all the fans - for free!

Definitely check this bar out if you are in San Francisco and want to watch a Giants game.
author: Kelsey S.

description:
Love this bar for so many reasons. Super chill environment and people, drink specials, stadium seating, and the list goes on. It's been a favorite for game days or just a casual happy hour.

FYI, they are no longer dog-friendly!
author: Amanda E.

description: Fantastic Spot to grab a drink and watch a game. NY bar with actual sets from Shea and Yankee stadiums.
author: Bruce U.

description: Bartenders are cool, drink prices are reasonable and the crowd is full of NY sports fans. What's not to love! Must try the frozen Irish coffee -- be warned it has equal amounts of caffeine and alcohol so you'll be a wide awake drunk.
author: laura f.

description: Decided to stop in here since we are pretty big NY fans. Really only gave a slight NY vibe. Drinks, service were good but I cant say there was much that really made this a GIANTS place to me besides a little décor.
author: Amanda W.

description: Ace's is a fantastic neighborhood dive!  The bartenders are fantastic, the music is good, and it's just an overall fun place to hang out.  I've always had a great time when I've been here.
author: Allison R.

description:
A friendly little sports bar that makes no apologies about looking like a sports bar. I appreciated the honesty and was grateful for the friendliness. Particularly when I ran into someone who I had accidentally smacked in the face with a ball just months before. 

Good times.
author: Loli L.

description: Just went for our first time to watch the mets game. Awesome place! Plenty of tvs, great crowd, and great bartending. Will go again!
author: J C.

description: Cheap, fast, and never too packed. It is always a good time and local spot to bring friends in town.
author: Thomas C.

description:
SF dive bar! 

We came here looking for mojitos. They didn't have any (-1 star!!! jk)

This place was dark and only slightly dingy. Wide variety of patrons (middle aged working class men, some old sketchy dudes, couple yuppies in the corner). 

I had a $3 tall boy can of Bud Light. F*CK yeah, happy hour.
author: Lauren M.

description:
A great choice by Kristina A, to host a pre Halloween shindig at this location.
Solid not too divey dive bar.
Drinks are simple and considering the location well priced.
The setup and design is solid, and not totally shabby as in most dives, actually looks like some thought went into the place.  Clientele is diverse - makes this place a solid choice between the TL and TD.

While on the night i happened upon this place there were some interesting costumes - the vibe of the bar was such that regardless of your costume or street clothes choice it was ok.

BTW - best costume seen here - was "the angel" - which I maintain - would be far more awesome if she got rid of the wings and went as cocaine.
author: Oleg H.

description:
Great place to grab a low key cheap ass beer and people watch.

This is a typical low key SF bar that attracts a diverse crowd. It seems busy enough that I would even call it a "happening" place for what it has to offer.

Cool location, good beer, great prices, chill environment.  Kudos for being open on Christmas.
author: Kathy S.

description:
I wouldn't really call this place either a dive bar or a lounge, this is clearly a sports bar. Don't believe me? Go in there and look around. Sure there are a couple couches but all of the sports memorabilia make it kind of obvious. Who picks the categories on yelp anyway?

This was one of the places on that big snuggie bar crawl a couple months ago I didn't perticipate but I did have friends that were going and I thought it might be fun to get to this place early and grab a seat. Here's a picture of my friend Gareth with Frank Chu and they are both wearing snuggies http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QKQAzwWhJHypMkfFjowchw?select=irELDW-Poy1NjagslW824Q

This a pretty standard neighborhood bar. I'd come back if someone else wanted to.
author: Manny F.

description: Great place. I'm an Aussie traveling alone and aces made me feel at home. Got me involved in convo at the bar, made me feel welcome and always attended to me when he was done chatting to everyone else. Owner even shouted me a shot. Great establishment funded and supported by enthusiasts, catering for enthusiasts. Definite destination must for those who are keen for your typical dive with local spice.
author: Cal S.

description: Great place to watch a game. Especially if you are a New Yorker. The only thing this place is missing is Brooklyn Brewery on tap. Met a lot of other New Yorkers here. Even ran into an old co-worker of mine from back home. Gets a little crowded on Sundays so get there early and enjoy the free BBQ.
author: Augusto M.

description:
If you like people who whack you on the arm with their beers and address you as "bro," you will like this place. Also, if you enjoy shouting "bro!" at other people and spilling your beer on them while watching hockey games, you will feel right at home. Chanting in unison with drunken crowds, wearing matching football jerseys, bellowing randomly at people walking by outside? Just the place for you. 

Otherwise, there's a supercool bar down the street called the Hemlock.
author: Thais N.

description: This place is pretty chill. There's a nice deal where you can request a booth with a keg for your birthday, which seems pretty cool. They also have a delightful drink called an "iced coffee" that is delicious. It tastes like a frosty with hints of alcohol. You pretty much have to get that if you come here.
author: Sam D.

description: Greatest NY Giants bar in the west!  This place is like olive garden, when you're here you're family.  BBQ up some food for giants fans, they treat ya right here.
author: christopher h.

description: Giving this place 5 stars because of the bartenders. Jared is my favorite bartender I this city. Jake and Colin are both rad too. But I really only come to aces when I know Jared is working and most regulars will probably say the same. Aces is my favorite bar and it's because of jake and Jared. Those dudes rock.
author: Miles T.

description: I miss NYC and this is a good place to come when I want to feel nostalgic. However, this is not really the type of "dive" bar that I would see classified as one in NYC. It's kind of a walk from the nearest subway (Montgomery), but Colin the bartender is real cool and gave my friend and I a buyback after 1 24 oz Bud can ($3 all day, everyday, a standard for what I would consider a dive). Place is probably a rocking good time for Giants/Knicks games so I'll definitely be back to partake in that when the season starts. They also let you bring in food from around.
author: Dan M.

description: Love coming to the place each time I'm in town. What makes it even better is the fact that I can watch the Anaheim Ducks on one of their TVs!
author: George G.

description: Easily my favorite bar in the city to watch sports. Bar tenders are extremely personable and playful and can usually accommodate my game, even if it's not NY or SF. Prices are low and atmosphere is chill. Overall I'm lucky to have this spot so close to my apartment.
author: Pouyan A.

description: This place is pretty cool. Took me about 5 minutes to realize I was in a New York bar. The got seats from Yankee and Shea Stadium.  Alot of NY natives. It really re m in da me of Finnertys  in Manhattan.
author: Kenneth S.

description:
This is what a bar is supposed to be like. Well done interior, mostly NY themed including some seats from Old Yankee Stadium when you walk in. They have about 8 TV's so you have a good vantage point from almost anywhere. 

Where they really move into 5 star territory is the atmosphere of the locals and bartenders that you see on a regular basis at this place. 

If you are a drinker and a sportsman like myself check out a game at Ace's.
author: Keith B.

description: Down-to-earth, good-vibe crowd. A bunch of screens for sports viewing, good drink specials and cool bartenders. Whadda you want? Ace is the place...
author: Ted R.

description:
Well....well what can I say Its Aces of all places....

Always a great time!!! You never know what characters will be there... Last time I was there Jarred was great to hang with.

Thank you for all you do!
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
This place is probably more like a 3-star, but I bump them up 1-star for having all the Hockey playoff games playing on the TV's.  I've found it frustratingly hard to find bars that have any of the LA Kings games playing(tough being an LA sports fan in SF...).  So, this review was from a Friday Night during Hockey Playoffs.  

It's a pretty good sports bar with fairly reasonable drink prices.  Double well Whiskey and mixer was $8. Not too bad.  Bartender was pretty on-top of drink orders and friendly.  They have a $20 minimum for CC's, but since I had already paid for a couple with cash, he let me charge my card just for the last drink.

Seems like there are a lot of regulars here.  And, there was a fair amount of people decked out in Hockey Jersey's, mostly Rangers, which I guess makes sense since it's kind of a NY bar.

This is now definitely my go to bar for Hockey games.
author: Ted G.

description: My husband is a huge NY Giants fan and wanted to watch the game on the last day of our honeymoon in SF.  We talked about just going to the airport early, but I looked on Yelp and found Ace's.  We walked over from our hotel, and it was perfect.  If you are a NY Giants fan and find yourself in SF on a Sunday during football season, you must go here!
author: Sally A.

description:
Dropped by here on a Saturday afternoon, hoping for somewhere fun to relax and catch the Michigan Wolverines game.

The bartender was very accommodating, and happily switched the nearest TV to the 
game we wanted. Drinks were very well priced, decor was fun and the service was great.

Once the games started, and the bar got busier, it was an interesting atmosphere for a sports bar: it never got super, super busy and even during big plays, no-one got super rowdy. For hardcore sports fans, this might be seen as a slight "lack of atmosphere", but for casual sports fans like us, it was perfect - we could happily watch the game  and get involved when we wanted, but it was still spacious enough, and not too raucous that we couldn't have our own conversation.

Can definitely see this becoming my go-to Saturday afternoon game spot.
author: Leigh H.

description: Came here to watch the first part of the niners game with a few of my buddies. Although this bar isn't in the best part of the city, the crowd was pretty good. There were many flat screen TVs displaying the game and the volume level was perfect. There were only two bartenders who were unfortunately careless and not attentive. Maybe they were hung over?
author: Anastasia N.

description:
$20 min for credit cards? You out yo mind son.

The door man was polite, the crowd amusing. Social and outgoing. Can't talk to the drinks because *ahem* we got there at 12:30 and no way I was drinking $20 in booze in one hour so I didn't drink. Decent amount of space, why they can't squeeze more than one unisex bathroom in there is a mystery. Women take for evvvver.

Shoulda gone to McTeague's up the block, $15 minimum they don't even really enforce, same priced booze. Maybe I'll try Ace's again someday, we'll see.
author: Justin N.

description: Love this place! It is a five star dive bar. new York themed, eclectic decor, and great drink specials.
author: John M.

description: Jared is the best and most handsome bartender in the city! Other bartenders are forgettable, but not him. The only reason I would go to this bar.
author: Liz A.

description: Great bar!! It's a NY Giants bar, I'm not actually a fan but my boyfriend is and it made him feel at home.  The very cool bartenders were super attentive.  They have free BBQ on Sundays and give out beer koozies to use while at the bar.  We will def be back soon!
author: Alicia V.

description:
Oh, Aces. 

The only NY bar in SF. 

I discovered you at 10 A.M. last April 2011. I walked by and not only were you open, peoples be sitting in 'yo chairs! If alcoholism was an Olympic sport and I was hyper attracted to Bay Area plumbers and welders, I'd have walked in! 

When the sun did dip below the Golden Gate- I strolled into your doors. Markus, the bouncer is a hot ex-Marine. If that's not enough, they serve ML in a can in a koozie! 

The crowd does get a little like what I imagine being on a cruise ship or living in Flushing, NY is like... BUT. You know. At least they're real. Unlike the rest of the men who pervade SF, the bearded PHD students in their mid-thirties who use their readin' skillz to avoid adulthood (read: GETTING A JOB!). 

Go here. Order food in. Meet people. Be kind. Tip well. Have fun.
author: Lianne S.

description: My girlfriend and I decided to walk from our hotel downtown to Turtle Tower for some Pho and halfway there saw Ace's open.  It was a good time to stop in for a refreshing beverage.  It looked like a great dive, so we were more than comfortable.  I went to the bar  to order and overheard the bartender talking about the Yankee with a customer who had a thick New York accent.  Didn't think anything of it until I started reading the memorabilia on the walls and asked the customer if he felt at home here.  his response, "Fella, you are currently on a small piece of New York real estate!".  Hilarious!  The drinks were stiff and the customers friendly.  Great place!
author: David M.

description:
When visiting San Francisco, we came here to catch a ball game (the bartender happily put on the Blue Jays game for us). This place was really great. Beer selection was standard but had a good variety. The bartender Tommy was quick with suggestions, as well as introductions to regulars. Deals were sweet, plus overall prices were great.
If you're looking for a great sports bar/ local watering hole...Ace's is it!
author: Joanna B.

description:
I had a friend visiting from NYC for the week, and we randomly came across this Giants bar.  As in, we were walking back to BART and I saw a bar with a Giants flag and yelled really loud.  My friend goes to pretty much all Giants home games = he was really excited.

It was of course mid-afternoon on a Tuesday, so of course we were down for a drink.  My friend was happy because of the Giants, I was happy because I love Beam and Cokes.

The bartender was cool and even offered to plug in my stupid smartphone behind the bar, so I didnt have to worry about plugging it in across the bar.  If you'll plug in my phone, then I will love you.  

Fun place for a midday weekday drink.  I'd go back here if I were wandering around the city again.
author: Sarah B.

description:
This may be the shortest review I've ever written because all I have to say is that this is the greatest place in the world. I moved to SF three weeks ago and I already feel like I'm at home when I walk in, get a hug from the door guy, high-five the bartenders as they put my drink down, and immediately begin a heated discussion of sports/politics/general drunken banter with whoever is sitting next to me. It's one of those places where you mean to go in for one drink after work and end up staying for 2 hours.

I don't know where I'll be living in 5 or 10 or 20 years but I know that Ace's will be getting a Christmas card from me for the next 50
author: Alisa B.

description: All ways a good time as Aces. Great sorts bar to watch your favorite bayarea teams at.
author: Travis R.

description:
I'll keep this short and sweet. I love dive bars, but Ace's just rubbed me the wrong way. Maybe it was the location (I prefer dive bars in a more populated/nicer area of the city), so this could be my fault for choosing a bar like this in the city, but I didn't think it was an appealing dive bar at all. A few creepy guys hanging around and not a good vibe in general. But my search for the best dive continues :)
Bonus points for the cheap drinks and TV's though!
author: Heather E.

description:
This place is perhaps the greatest bar ever created by man.  This is not an opinion, this is a fact.  Lets go over a few things:

1) This is a New York Yankees bar, but is managed by 2 Bostonians.  Let that sink in for a minute.
2) Read #1 again.  Bigfoot bartending here would be less of a surprise.
3) Good drinks, super cheap.
4) Miyagi....dude is always there and is a legend.
5) The staff here is awesome, super friendly funny as hell, makes me feel like I am back home in NY (minus the Boston accents)

Seriously, if you are in the area and dont stop in here, let me know and I will call your parents and let them know what a disappointment you turned out to be.  Nice big TV's, sports are always on, darkly lit so that I appear better looking than I actually am.  Ace's, if I weren't married and I could feasibly date you, guess what, I would.
author: Liam M.

description:
Great atmosphere, location & enthusiastic NY Giants fans. The place is small and it got quite crowded during the playoff game.

Free BBQ? What?!

Drinks are cheap, bathrooms are (relatively) nice, and you get a cuzzi w/ every beer!

I WANT TO BE A PART OF IT - NEW YORK, NEW YORK!
author: Harold C.

description:
Place is okay, looks like a typical sports bar but I'm sure it gets extremely packed during game times. Mainly, went there to have a few drinks with some friends from New york as well as meeting new friends. 

I did like the giant poker table that's located immediately at the back when you enter the room. Great for when you have a large number of people coming in for a good time.
author: Iris M.

description:
Ace's is a great staple.

I always have a great time here and there are a ton of interesting patrons. I have seen one particular patron there a few times. He calls himself Mr. Miyagi, and so does everyone else. If he is there you will definitely notice him and may even be lucky enough to have a conversation with him. 

They have a full bar, good beer on tap and are reasonably priced. The jukebox has the full Dazed and Confused soundtrack which is really important to me.

I'm always happy to visit.
author: Denise S.

description: I am a bay area native but the couple years I spent in in Manhattan were quite memorable. I love SF but NYC has a special place in my heart and it is places like this that enable me to experience NYC on a small scale here in the city. I love all the details (stadium seats, NYC metro references etc.). I don't expect the vast majority of people to agree with my rating but anyone who has spent any significant time in NYC, this place will resonate with you.
author: E E.

description:
Not great. This is the kind of place that is only fun if you come with at least 5 other people or you know everyone that works there. Someone brought in a tupperware dish full of ground beef and I assume someone was bringing chips later or something. My friend and I kept getting the feeling like we were interrupting a private party though nothing was reserved and no one said anything. Overall just weird and not any place I intend to visit again.

oh and tons of creepy looking guys who don't have nearly enough guts to actually talk to women but just a smidge enough to stare at you like a psycho.
author: Rhonda G.

description:
We rented out Ace's for New Year's this year and everything from the planning to the execution was flawless by the Ace's team.  

Planning: I've been involved in renting out places for various events over the years and it had never been this easy and hassle free to manage leading up to the event. The price was incredibly reasonable compared to what other places would charge (especially on NYE) for a private event with an open bar. They even threw in some light food for the party at no additional cost. I can't stress enough how easy it was to work with the owner and manager when planning the event. Great guys that you'd want to hang out with regardless.

The event: I provided a list of names of who was attending (80 people) and they had a bouncer manage the door which took off all the pressure from me at the event. As an organizer, I didn't have to do anything at the party so I got to have fun like everyone else. They took care of everything. The atmosphere is perfect for an event - the bar is big and is perfectly accessible to everyone since the room is more of a square than a rectangle which is typical of most SF bars (no crowding at the bar blocking off the walkway). My friends kept commenting on how comfortable the place was. They also had 2-3 bartenders working at all times so no one ever had to wait for drinks which is key when having an open bar. The bartenders themselves were great and very friendly. Overall, it was a huge success and everyone at the party had a great time.

Everyone involved in the process (owner, manager, bartenders, etc) were awesome to work with...they have a great group of people running the place (professional and classy but also fun). I highly recommend renting out Ace's for whatever event you are planning.
author: Tim R.

description: Stopped in yesterday for a drink with my friend and we had a really good time.  The bartender was friend and the service was great.  It was very clean and we will definitely be stopping in again.
author: Siobhan C.

description:
Was there on Saturday for the 49er's game (kick ass game!). The place was packed, there was no where to sit, the people were loud and intense! So for a sports bar it was perfect. One of the few times in SF I felt like everyone in one place was having a great time (except for this one sad Saints fan). 

They have a bucket of 5 16 oz buds for $12. So it was a great time. I will probably go back on a regular night and see how the crowd is then.
author: Brandon R.

description:
I dont normally use this word, but the bartender was kinda a douche. He wasnt friendly and it wasnt crowded enough for him to be so stressed out.

There is a $20 minimum on all credit card charges, which is a lot for me. I rarely drink $20 worth of alcohol in one night let alone when I am only in the mood for a single beer.

The place is on the smaller side, and when I went on a Tuesday night, it wasn't too crowded (which is something I appreciate). There are some bar stools around and one giant booth to sit at, which my friends and I shared with another group. 

Well drinks are $5 and draft beers are $4. not too bad :)
author: Kailey O.

description: This is a dive but if you are a die hard NY sports fan and need to surrounded by real people with real personalities....aka....not the fake I like everyone Cali persona this is the place to go and get recharged with NY / NJ accents and attitudes.  It gets crowded though....not for the faint of heart if you are going there to root for the other team and def not a kid's place!  Go NY Football Giants!!!!!
author: Kim H.

description: Such a great place to go!! Rather it be for a night out, football/baseball game, or just to chill Ace's is the place to go!! Adam is an awesome bartender and I wish he worked at every bar in the city! Great service from everyone there in general!
author: Katie G.

description:
Calling this place a dive is a bit harsh, don't you think? I think 'dive' is the new way of saying 'not the Marina'. This place is not a dive but a great, great neighborhood bar. As soon as we walked in, I loved it. They had my all time favorite picture of Frank Sinatra (his New Jersey mug shot). It's comfortable, friendly (there are dogs running around) and a great TV set up for sports. We watched the Warriors game as well as  Monday Night Football. There's no food at Ace's but they were cool with us ordering in pizza from Pizza Orgasmica. 

Normally, I'd deduct a star for any SF bar that doesn't serve Anchor Steam (think globally, drink locally. Right?) but Ace's was indeed aces so I'll happily let them slide. Oh, and they had the Sinatra pic on the back of an Aces t-shirt which I purchased and will wear proudly.
author: Brian B.

description:
The Bloody Marys here are fantastic. I wish I could give you more info, but I was about half way into my first one when a cat fight broke out between two gay men at the end of the bar. When they were separated, verbal taunts continued to fly, and I was forced to move because I wanted nothing to do with that. I like to drink in peace, thank you.

Like the decor, but a New York-themed sports bar in San Francisco seems a little odd. Especially in the Polk Gulch. But whatever.
author: Wes T.

description:
It's a nice enough bar: the place looks nice, the drinks are average for the area, decent specials.
So why the low rating?
The staff.
The bartenders literally do not give a shit if you drink or not unless they know you here. We went back on three different occasions, different days of the week even, to give it a chance, but the results were consistent across the board.
No matter if there are fifty customers or five you will wait a long while to get served because the staff would rather chat with their pals than pull drinks. I watched two bartenders serve a group of regulars two rounds before checking on the rest of the bar.  That is a long time in bar years, my friends. 
I'm not even complaining about their shitty attitudes, fuck dude, I'm from back East, you do your job well, you serve a decent drink in a timely fashion you can be a dick for all I care. But if you can't even do your job then you better be a pretty nice guy or we're going elsewhere for our booze.
author: James R.

description:
Came in to watch a few baseball games this year. Sports Memorabilia including actual Yankee Stadium seats were all over the place which was a nice touch.

BJ's were $8 - Bud and Jameson which is rather reasonable with domestic beers also being about $3 to $4. They have the package for basically all sports teams with the focus being New York and Boston teams.

I recommend the place if you are in the area - particularly if your looking to watch a ball game.
author: Brian D.

description:
Why is it that he and I are always SO FUCKING LATE EVERYWHERE WE GO. 

Well, at least we had a good excuse this time...kinda sorta. I'd like to start my drinking early on, but noOoOoOo I had to WAIT for him to get home so we could leave to go to Aces for DYL. An hour and a half after waiting, he finally arrives. 

him: "We gotta go"
me: "What? Ok...is it with the cab outside?"
him: "No. But we gotta go"
me: "What?!"
::pounding at door:: cab driver: "I KNOW WHERE YOU LIVE"
me: "WTF IS GOING ON!?!?!"
him: "We gotta go"

Turns out the cab driver refused to drop by the place to pick me up, and then drop us off at Ace's, and the tab was 8.05, so he asked for 12 bucks back and told him to deal with the extra 5 cents.

So that added yet ANOTHER hour of wait time. There goes 3 hours I could have been drinking...down the drain...down, down...down...

We FINALLY arrive at the place. We get out of the cab and I storm in to our fellow yelpers and demand instant liqour injestion. Hell, if I had an IV no doubt I would have hooked that sucka up.

So for the next few hours I drink. And drink. And drink. Then drink some more. I'm pretty fucked up by the end of the night. Actually, I don't think I remember going home. 

Their staff is awesome friendly, the bar itself is super cool, and the fact that it opens up at 6am 365 days a year warrants an extra star. 

Oh and such an AWESOME bar to go to if the weather is bitchin!
author: Jaime L.

description: I heart Aces!  You don't have to be a die hard New York fan to come here but you probably don't want to be rooting against NY =).  The staff is really friendly and the rabid NY fans are entertaining.  They have a good number of beers on tap and for a really not so good looking bloody mary (no olives no celery), their bloody mary is pretty darn tasty.  And to top it all off they serve free bbq, yes free bbq.  Oh and if you are like me and need a cup of coffee to start the morning they let you bring in your own cup of coffee.  I will definitely be back to watch the 49ers go all the way to the Super Bowl!!!!!
author: Jen C.

description:
There is not much I can say that hasn't been said. Great drink prices, awesome bartenders, made a few friends there along the way.

There is always a pretty diverse crowd throughout the day and every night of the week. 

And you can't review Ace's without mentioning Miyagi.  He's a national treasure.
author: Dottie G.

description: 5-stars to the best January-2nd-omg-i-am-so-effing-hungover-bloody-mary I've ever had. Exxxxtra spicy is the way to go #horseradish #horseradish
author: Kristal N.

description:
Places that try to pretend to be dive bars stick out like a sore thumb to me.
This place is like that.
Sure, there's the old Asian drunk guy sitting there at the bar with his eyes closed saying he's meditating but really he's just passed out drunk.
Sure there's the old sports memorabilia...but it's beat out by the fancy shirts that all the bartenders wear. 
The bar is super lit up and bright. 
The drinks aren't dive bar prices. 
There's that too.
author: Lauren S.

description: Shocking door man....very rude. We're from the UK so we showed driving licenses at the door but were told you need passports. Avoid if you're not from the US.
author: Jason A.

description: i really looked forward to enjoying this bar but the bouncer was extremely rude and went out of his way to upset my group and other potential patrons.  If you value your self worth go somewhere else.
author: Charles W.

description:
Two words...GO GIANTS!
This place is a must see for every east coaster in San Francisco. Game days rock with complimentary BBQ, great fans, and a great staff. Hands down one of my favorite places in the city.
author: Amy S.

description: A lousy place. The regulars are a group of meatheads, totally rowdy greaseballs with low IQ's and suburban mechanic's attitude.  You can cut the hostility with a knife here. I have seen arguments, shouting, rude remarks, rants, and low life regulars who gather and ignore anyone who isn't a regular.  The owner obviously doesn't care that non-regulars are treated poorly, he seems more concerned about maintaining a place for low-class regulars to congregate.  No need to go here, unless you have a craving for poorly made drinks, rough and gritty (and unattractive) regulars who are hot headed and homophobic. Ugh...NO thank you.  We will take our money to a REAL San Francisco bar, not some New Jersey knock-off.
author: Sara D.

description:
Was in town on business and Ace's was down the street from my hotel.

Cool place. Chill crowd.
Felt like a Chicago bar.

Check it out if you are in Nob Hill.
author: Kelly V.

description:
We were sitting at Sugar Cafe, meeting on a collaborative project, when we noticed the music volume increasing to the point we couldn't hear five feet from our heads. Now, I know Sugar goes from cafe to nightclub at some witching hour during the night, but when I looked around all I saw were a couple of people on their laptops and a couple of people at the bar. When one of us asked if they could possibly turn the volume down, the guy at the counter refused, and then facilitated by turning the knob down by one notch.

Whatever.

So I suggested Ace's, a bar I had been to before and liked well enough. Upon entering, we were greeted by a smile, quick service and cheap drinks. I asked the bartender what their well whiskey was (I drink that straight because I can), and he smiled and directed me to a row of empty Old Crow bottles along the wall, apparently cleaned out by the staff. 

Nice. 

But here's where Ace's differentiates itself from our previous venue: when the bartender saw we were meeting about something, he walked over and asked us if we wanted the music in our area turned down...

Did you get that?

He came to US and ASKED US if we wanted the music turned down.

That's what you call customer service. We sort of sat there dumbfounded and surprised with a "what the hell just happened?" look on our faces...

Ace's now ranks as one of my top bars in San Francisco, a little bit of New York in the heart of the city.
author: Keane L.

description: I love this place because it has the nicest bartenders of anywhere i have been in SF. Super mellow vibe. It can get crazy late at night but crazy in a good way. I would say this is my favorite neighborhood bar. Watch some baseball have some Budweiser. What else do you need.
author: Jon M.

description: Went last night and it was disgusting I've been there before half a dozen times and it wasn't great and always knew it was a dive bar so not much expectations. But as soon as I sat down and ordered a bloody mary I began to smell nauseous fumes similar to very bad body odor, dirty undergarments and it made me sick I had to stand over to the window for air. The bloody mary was amateurish at best this place is dive but it doesn't have to stink.
author: N A.

description:
This could be a "Cheers" bar!  I mean, on Sunday during football season, everybody knows your name! 
Well I'm speaking as an outsider who went here once and did so by taking advice from two strangers in Giants gear walking past me and my BF at the very same moment that we were looking for a place to watch the Giants game.  They were going a different route, but pointed us to Ace's.  The bartenders are super friendly, were calling patrons by first name, and keeping up with the game at the same time. They had a BBQ out front that I learned was being tended by the doorman.  Yes, he made us all lunch for free (tips welcome).  I think I saw chicken and sloppy Joe's! I couldn't believe how generous they are!
Also the price of a pint wasn't bad either! 
Great place for Sundays
author: Becka C.

description:
This is a great bar for all different occasions.  On any given night this could be just a chill place to hang out if you want some time away from the normal SF crowd.  They have beer coozies, a jukebox, and an old asian man named "miyagi" that just hangs out and looks like he's seen better days.  The bartenders are great, I'm partial because one is a friend.  

Ace's is a great place to go for watching the game too.  They are nice enough to drag out a grill and cook up free chicken, hot dogs and burgers.  Can't beat that!  Whats even more fun is watching the colorful characters that live in the area wander by and yell at the patrons near the open windows.  Its a bit more crowded on days like this...but its much better than those douchebags trying to get into greens.
author: jessica b.

description: You got to love a place that is a mix between Cheers and Road House. Awesome drink specials everyday are not bad ether.
author: Michael T.

description:
This review is pretty much solely for the bar as a Wisconsin Badger bar- we went here for the first UW football game of the season and it felt like I was transported back to Wisconsin (which is a great thing).  $2 miller lights and $3 rails during Badger games.  Sounds like Wisconsin to me!  In addition, everyone was wearing Wisconsin Badgers gear, the bartenders played "Jump Around" at one point, and everyone put their arms around each other and sang "Varsity" at the end of the game.  

As a bar, it was clean, the bartenders were very nice, and the ambiance was good...I'll be back for the next game, at least!
author: Luthien N.

description:
Randomly picked this bar for SEC football viewing on the same day as santacon...didn't expect the bar to be overran by santas, elves, and random Xmas themed ppl (tho I did enjoy the chocolate covered biscuit a random Santa gave me while waiting for my beer)

It's a cozy little bar with 5 plasma tvs (though kinda small). Altho only one tv can have sound at any given time (somebody was there first for the Oregon game) 

The bartenders are really nice and the drinks are cheap! One of em even gave us some free pizza!

Though close to half time the popos shut down the bar due to overcapacity. We got to get back in tho since we were just there for the game.

Def would love to come back again another time. Great place to just chill n drink with friends!
author: Jenny C.

description:
I love Aces!  Its one of the few bars in the city that I could walk in alone and feel completely comfortable. Anyone can come into this bar and have a good time, ok well maybe not pretentious people but the crowd ranges the whole spectrum.  

The regulars are super nice, the bartenders are awesome and the jukebox rules!  Not to mention its a Yankee bar!  But don't let that deter you, I've seen Sox fans, Giants fans, Dodger fans, etc....get the drift, they like sports.  

Even if you don't like sports the bartender has always been super kind. He's even let my friends and I take over the booth with our store bought food and watch Wipeout.  Big nights we would never ask to change the channel but if its slow they are more than willing to oblige.
author: Kristin Marie S.

description:
No aces here. Just spaces, phases, drunken hazes, second bases, basketcases and a bunch of ugly faces. Trashy.

Aces fail.
author: Y K.

description: First time in SF. Happened across Aces one half block from our hotel (also great). Small corner bar with NY fan feel. Friendly, helpful bartenders. Kind to Detroit fans.  Open windows and half doors keep the bar cool when temps rise. Not for those looking for haute cuisine. This is a BAR. No food. Meeting new friends the goal.
author: Ed S.

description:
As a lost tourist, I was thrilled that Aces was next door to my tiny hotel.
Cozies for beer cans, cheap beer and super friendly locals!

Highly recommended.

Oh, and for the two guys who were sitting at the end of the bar, one was a nodded off 60 year old Asian dude, the other youngish dude smelled of the 
420!
author: Aggon A.

description: Classic corner bar! If you're a NY Giants fan, this is the place to be for the games. Cheap drinks, great bartenders, good vibe. Don't think about it. Just go.
author: Matthew K.

description:
I'd probably give Ace's four or three stars just walking in, but I went here with Keane L and some other un-named co-conspirators working on a super secret project.  

Anyhow, as Keane mentioned, it is true, the bartender actually came over to our crew and (since he noticed us conspiring and writing down notes in the booth couches) and asked if we wanted to have the speakers in that area turned down. 

What?  customer service and friendliness in a divey bar?  yep!  there it was.  So Ace's get five stars for actually caring about it's customers - unlike Sugar Cafe down the street where the sound seemed to get louder every time we opened our mouths.
author: Gene X.

description: This place is located dangerously close to me and I've had quite a few BJ's here. As others note it gets really crowded for big games and is both a wisconsin badger and new york giants bar. One thing I love is that they blast the sound out for the games which a lot of bars fail to do for some reason. They have some everyday specials including the above mentioned BJ (Bud and Jameson for 8 bucks).
author: Clayton V.

description:
I visited this place on vacation last year while following the New York Mets play the SF Giants.  This place is a NY transplants dream, it is covered wall to wall with NY memrobillia mainly paying homage to the Yankees and Giants (The NY Football Giants).

The owner Scotty is awesome and will go out of his way to make sure you have a great time while in town.  And how can you not love a bar that barely closes.  I was in San Fran for 5 days and I spend each one of them opening the bar at Aces and closing it out too. 2am is way too early to close, especially for those of us from NY.

Drinks are cheap and they even had their own BBQ to feed all us New Yorkers when we were there.  Might just be the best sports bar on either coast!

I plan on going back everytime I go to SF
author: PJ K.

description:
Ace's is a dive bar in the tenderloin. It's a Yankee/NY Giants bar so I like it. I met my best friends in SF there (really, that's how we met) and surprise, surprise, they're all transplants from NY/Jerz.

Ace's is the kind of place that you can do whatever you want and people just let you live. Everyone wants to chat, takes shots, and vigorously debate Eli Manning whether or not they know you. During football games, they grill outside on the sidewalk and give out the food for free (tip your bartenders people).

There is a sandwich shop just up the block that I get THE BEST sandwiches from, bring them back to Aces, sit on a stool next to their huge open window, sip my cheap bud light, and watch the game. Does it get any better?
author: L C.

description:
So one strolling through my neighborhood, I magically ran into a new friend and found myself at Ace's. The way we found ourselves here really doesn't matter- but any chance I get to drink a free Blood Mary with good company and conversation is okay by me.

Earlier last week my favorite red wallet with my ID and lucky charm- my Ace of Hearts card I found outside the gate to my apartment- came up missing. I do still have my (expired) Michigan ID, so if they need backing up, I have that along with a picture I took of my California license on my sort of working iPhone. 

After the good conversation and company, I'm convinced I don't need a lucky charm in a city as fantastic as San Francisco. Everywhere I go I see new things, meet new people, and am constantly entertained because there's something changing at all times. As far as the ID goes, I do really need to go to the DMV and stop procrastinating. I'm keeping my fingers crossed the wallet turns up somewhere.
author: Kristin F.

description:
We all came to Ace's to watch Timmy shutdown the Braves in yesterdays game. I didn't know this until I got there, but Ace's is predominantly a New York bar, so they support all the New York teams, but there was a good group of Giants fans there. 

They also offered free food - burgers, corndogs, hotdogs, mac & cheese - and there were $2 beer deals. 

Overall this is a great bar with really friendly patrons and staff - will definitely be coming back to watch the games.

GO GIANTS!!!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
After watching both the Giants game and the Yankees world series clinching game there last night, I give Aces a strong 5 stars.

As a New York transplant, this place makes me happy.  Covered in NY paraphernalia complete with seats from the old Yankee and Shea stadiums, its easy to feel the NY vibe.  The owner and bartenders all seem to have NY roots and are all friendly and inviting.  Even with a packed bar, it was easy to get the bartenders attention and get another $3 Bud 16ozer.  As a bonus on Sundays, they grill burgers, chicken and brats on the street and serve them up for free inside!

It seemed like everyone there was a NY fan and many high fives and hugs were exchanged throughout the night.  We will definitely be back for all the World Series games and any other NY sporting event.  If you are a fellow NYer or fan of NY sports, you must check out Aces. 

Go Yanks!
author: Michael R.

description:
There are a few places in this world that I consider my favorites- Kelly's Roast Beef outside of Boston, The Billiards Bar at the Hard Rock Hotel in Vegas, The Ritz Carlton in Half Moon Bay to name a few.

Another of those places is Ace's in San Francisco- I was trying to think about how to describe this place in some witty way but decided that the best thing to do was to post what I posted to my Facebook when I was there this past Christmas Eve...

"Sitting in one of my favorite bars in the world, watching "A Christmas Story" with no sound, everyone in the joint is singing "Fairytale of New York" as loud as they can- got a full belly, my Baby by my side and hoisting one for baby Jesus- this is the reason for the season!"

If that doesn't get you to go then maybe you'll be doing us all a favor...
author: Chris D.

description: Decent dive bar. It's a New York bar and they seem to be into soccer as well. Opens early so if you have a powerful thirst in the AM, this is your spot.
author: Michael B.

description: The kind of place where they clean off the bar so you can do a victory dance on it. Neeeeeeew Yoooooooork!!!!
author: Julie P.

description: I only give it three  stars because Jake is a the only great bartender and I love their Ace wife beaters shirts. . Normally i come kind of early in the morning and i am stuck with a angry gay guy who hates me ( I think he just hates his life because i do not go there much but when i do the walk of shame endup there from time to time he is there) and normally most gay guys love me and a bunch of misogynists men.  Unless i get lucky to have jake there. Actually the only bar i ever got kick out of in SF after telling a guy off for grabbing my ass. It must have been the time. I have actually had a great time other times of days . I even have one of their shirts that i love. I love the wife beaters but not the wlfe beaters at the bar as in their shirts. lol But they should be way more nice to ladies their during the morning. I guess it is just a bad bartender. He is some fat guy. lol Looks miserable. He looks like he hates his life and hates women.
author: Gayle B.

description:
I used to live right on Sutter and Hyde and there was a bar that occupied this place called the Overflow.  The patrons were Tender-Nob barflies, good people, a lot of ex military, no yuppie rif-raf.  We even had a baseball team and a billiard team that was on the bar circuit with the bars around the neighborhood.

I came here when I moved back to the Bay expecting and my old haunt and saw Aces....wow.....ummm.....I felt like I was in the Marina?  

It did look like everyone there was having fun, not my style but if you want to get a Marina girl drunk and live life on the edge and take her to the Tenderloin this is your spot.  Yay.
author: Richard N.

description: Odd that this place doubles as a NY Giants and Green Bay Packers / Wisconsin Badgers bar.  Talk about an odd couple.  Anyway, fun dive with friendly bartenders.
author: John H.

description:
This place works for me.  Big spacious, bartenders are on it, and most important, they have a jukebox!!! Wooo, I was the Jukebox Hero Saturday night.  Not so much if you are looking to pick up dudes.  

Had a pal on the hunt w/ us and she was not seeing any prospects.  Seems to be a like a place to go w/ a group.  But, you will not melt due to the heat.  Would for sure go back.
author: Nicole F.

description: I love this place it opens at 6 am , it's in nob hill so great peeps, and it's open at 6 am lol, and Fucking kick ass bloody Mary's?
author: Jenn D.

description: we came here from Brooklyn and staying in the hotel nearby. We are very happy to be I'm this bar, sooooooo friendly. The most friendly and least pretentious place since we came to SF.
author: H K.

description: This place has NHL Center Ice! I was looking for a place to watch the LA Kings game while visiting SF and they put it on. They made sure to put in on a tv that I had a good view of. Nice selection of beer as well. I'll definitely hit this place up again especially to watch some hockey!
author: Aaron A.

description:
The only beef I have with this place is that the bartender wasn't very friendly.  I wouldn't go as far as saying rude, just not friendly like a bartender should be.

During the superbowl, they had tallboy Bud Lights for $2!! Can't beat that; what a deal!  They also serve FREE FOOD that they grill outside the bar.  I still haven't tried the hotdogs or burgers, but everything looked delicious...

Pretty cool bar in the tendernob; I'm sure I'll be back soon as I also think it's the Bay Area Badgers bar.
author: Jenny W.

description:
Some insane old bat who lives upstairs from this bar will pour water on you if you are being too loud outside, so keep your voices to a sober level even if you are not sober. 

This may seem a bit difficult since this is a sports bar and sports bars, especially this one, provoke some sort of male yelling at the TV ritual, as if the TV is equip to let Cain know his aim is off and he needs to step it up lest he make Zito look like  a competent player (I just looked these players up on the Giants website as I have no clue whatsoever about sports, so don't  go getting all crazy on me about misrepresenting these players skills. This comment was strictly to make a point about the noise levels of this ritual, not the importance of WHY you are yelling at an inanimate object like a crazy person, or who you are yelling about).

If you can catch this place when no sports are playing you will find that the bartenders have favorite bands, such as Social Distortion and U2. You will discover that certain bands CDs, as well as house compilations with several songs by said bands, appear in the jukebox in several conspicuously spaced locations. You will also find that the selection, though heavy on a select few bands, is lively and you will likely find something you enjoy. 

There are lots of windows to let the light in during daylight hours. This is a good thing since this bar opens at 6AM, and many bars that open this early do not have a lot of windows, thus making your 6AM drinking seem even more downtrodden than it already is if you need to hit the booze that early in the morning. 

The drinks are average, selection pretty good and the prices decent, especially during happy hour when they knock a buck off your beer or well drink. Not a destination bar, but a good place to pop in if you are craving some Social D, a few screaming men, a refreshing shower and a morning (or afternoon, or evening) beverage of the alcoholic variety.
author: Drue C.

description:
If you want to take a break from the see-and-be-seen crowd and be a barfly for the night, Ace's is your place. It's a great little neighborhood gem in the Tendernob with low lighting, friendly bartenders and cheap drinks. I think we may have scared away the regulars, though. 

Thank god they let us order in pizza. That will be my hangover saver tomorrow. Those DYLers, I tell ya. They know how to party!
author: Nicole G.

description: This place is amazing. The guys always make us feel welcome. Good beer, good prices, great sports bar.
author: J M.
