description: Good beer on tap, decent drinks and prices. The two star rating is for the service, which is horrible. Unless you are someone they know, you will be waiting 10 minutes to get their attention because they are too busy chatting it up.
author: Amy B.

description:
How to get Rachel in a good mood: 

1. Compliment her clothes/hair/triceps/whatever
2. Give her deals on drinks

That's it. I'm easy to please. Ace's bartenders took care of numbers 1 and 2 and put me in a good mood that Friday night.

It's also a few short blocks away from Hemlock if you need a little more action in your Friday night. 

All in all, kind of a ruling place.
author: Rachel F.

description: I happened upon this place Saturday afternoon as I was trying to find somewhere to kill time waiting for someone.  I wish I could have stayed longer.  Inside it was dark and cool and a nice respite from our mini heatwave that day.  The big windows let in the hustle of the street and made the space feel even larger than it is.  There was a decent crowd of folks who all seemed to know the bartender and each other.  The place has a real neighborhood bar feeling to it.  Don't know how it is at night, but I'll definitely be back some hot, lazy afternoon to kick back with beer and a book.
author: Valeria R.

description:
This place has the Alissa D. Seal of Approval. You can quote me on that. 

This bar is not a dive. But any bar that isn't glitzy is a dive in yelp parlance, I think. Oh well. It's a perfectly good, nice neighborhood bar in the loin/nob  border zone. It's fun to walk up here from BART, you get offers to buy all sorts of chemicals!  

The bartenders are friendly, and great.  And the drinks are good. And there is plenty of seating. And there was a dog running around. Very pretty, and very friendly. 

I wish there were a bar like this in my neighborhood!
author: neil c.

description:
Not many bars in SF know how to make the classic old man drinks.  Ace's is place to go if you want to kick it old school in the booze department.  Especially since Owl Tree is gone.

DYL really made this a great night.  My first and not my last.  
I love the cowboy style swing doors. 
The night ended with an awesome trek through the TL.  Thanks for being my wing man Emily.
author: amanda v.

description:
I think its funny that Nicole would leave that review... hum, lets recap-- 
1.You were "86'ed from the bar". 
2. You "poured your money into the wonderful bartenders". 
I would wager that maybe you were wasted at the bar and caused a scene week after week. Oh wait... I know that because I saw it.
Aces is a bar where everyone can go and are they are treated like "regulars".  If you don't act a fool than you will have a good time. The bartenders are beyond nice and Scotty treats people fairly and kindly.
I am not sure how anyone could "offend the regulars" by cheering for the "home team"-- wouldnt the regulars of the bar know its a Giants bar?
I think I make my point... 
Aces is a bar where ANYONE can go and have a great time....as long as you don't act like a douche bag, get wasted Sunday after Sunday and try to start fights. If that happens, yes...you too might be 86'ed. 

Viva Aces.
author: none n.

description: Your standard dive bar located in the fun Sutter/Leavenworth neighborhood. Don't come in expecting to find dancing and loud techno music. Sit down, relax, order a shot of Sailor Jerry (ALWAYS $3) and have a chat with the friendly staff. Close enough to be a starting point before you hit the strip of Polk st, Aces is a fun, down to earth experience allowing either a cheap pre-game or a relaxing brew after work. No cover unless the Giants, the NY Giants, make the superbowl again.
author: Alexander S.

description: Love it! That's my kind of bar...! I'm gonna hit it up again tonight!
author: Michael B.

description:
The quintessential dive/sports bar, Aces is a can't miss for Sunday football. The beers are reasonably priced, the crowd looks picked from a Springstein or Bon Jovi video, the BBQ is free and the bathrooms are surprisingly clean.

My friend Elliot introduced me today to this Nob Hill favorite and I'll most likely be back again. We had a blast and enjoyed the highly anticipated free BBQ. Luckily, we had a spot by the front windows, so we could spot the "sexy chef" finishing up the grilled goods and making his way inside, thus securing our spots in the rapidly formed lines. If you miss a free round of BBQ, you're welcome to bring in outside food and there's a grocery/deli located next door.

Overall, Aces is more than what you'd expect, but all that you'll need. Give em a shot.
author: Seth S.

description:
The photos of this bar made me a bit weary, but man! The bar is cool, sultry and full of nice locals. That's bound to happen when you are open at 6am every single day of the year (even the Zeitgeist closes ONE day)!
Scott is an awesome bartender, pours a Guinness just right and creates amazing cocktails off the cuff, served with panache!
author: Colleen B.

description:
Went here for my first yelp event this past friday. 

The bartenders are awesome. Super friendly and sociable. Megan is probably the best bartender I've ever had :) 

It's a pretty chill place, not overly crowded, which makes it a winner in my mind. Music is a little loud, but so is the crowd, so no complaints.


Happy hour is the usual happy hour prices. Drinks are strong and good.

What else, what else? It's very red.. and the restroom is clean  :)
author: Eugenia Y.

description:
There were even nice to me when drink, the hot weather and other elements got the best of me... I... um... didn't handle it well gastronomically.

They gave me water, a cool cloth and helped my friends get me a cab home.

Very classy.
author: Kate R.

description:
If you're a New Yorker, decent place to soak up some games with other fellow transplants.

If you're not, prepared to feel like you're actually back in New York with some pretty hostile and drunken locals who seem to forget they're in San Francisco.
author: Barca F.

description: This is the unofficial/official Badger Bar, Giant's Bar, Packer Bar and Bears Bar. I went there for the NFL playoff games and it was pretty fun. They get stars for having $2 Miller Lites and kielbasa. The place is really really small, but has a nice friendly feel. Not going to be my favorite bar in the city, but will be a fun place to go during college football season.
author: Joanne H.

description:
The actual bar and the bartenders/doorguy were pretty darn awesome. It's a little too sports bary for me, but I could still definitely see myself hanging out here.

The people that were there, however, were totally not my type of people.
author: Ge O.

description:
Yea!!

I love this bar!  It use to be the Overflo and I can remember my dad convincing the old seedy bartender to let me see the inside.  And although Aces can definitely still be considered a dive bar, it looks great!

I totally dug the bartenders- attentive, cute, funny, great accent, ect!  I also loved that they had a spare iPhone charger plugged in and ready to go!  It's more of a beer/ shot bar than fancy drinks, but they provide coozies for the beers, which I have to say I've never seen before.

My girlfriends and I spent most of the night playing Nudie Hunt.

I plan to return!
author: Gina N.

description:
Went to my second DYL at Aces, and it was a good time which I will go into. But as some other Yelpers have pointed out, this IS NOT a Dive bar. 

This is just a neighborhood bar. It's not clubby, it doesn't fill up often I assume. But we need to make a disticnction between Dives and nieghborhood bars. Dives don't have 2! flatscreen TV's. Dives aren't usually as clean as Aces. Ace's had relatively nice art on the walls. I would love to see people stop calling anything that isn't a club or a sports bar a dive bar. That's all. 

All of that being said, Ace's was a lot of fun for the $3 bud light tall boys, clean enough bathrooms, and ease of movement. Unlike a lot of bars, even at capacity there are no real choke points in Ace's, making movement back and forth easy. +1 Star for the window that was open allowing us to smoke and drink at the SAME TIME. 

-1 Star for the crazy lady we were later told about by the bartender who drops water on unsuspecting smokers. We got hit. 

Thanks Nicole G for the shot glass!
author: Jake R.

description:
I've been hesitant to review aces. Why? because it was my go to place after class and I never wanted to share this place. But I have finally after one year of contemplating will finally write a review;

 I used to live a beautiful 5 blocks from this place and I would get my ass down the hill every friggin Wednesday to get my drink on. No one judged me for sipping on my jameson and coke at 3PM....

This place is so convenient since it's two blocks from one of my classes. Unfortunately I ditched snob hill and moved to soma and have been needing my Aces fix! 

NOT a dive bar..mhmkthnx.
Bartenders are always super friendly and there's always something good on the screens. 

Scotty, Megan, Tommy & cutie bear Mike I adore you!
author: Amanda S.

description:
Came here last Saturday eve to support my boy's undying love for the Wisconsin Badgers. Apparently, this bar was recently deemed the official Badger alumni bar for all the Wiscos to gather and watch football games. 

Sure, there were enough TV screens to watch the Badgers romp Fresno State at every angle, but overall it seemed like an odd location choice. I think the regulars were a bit confused why a sea of red-clad, Miller-drinking fans were hanging out in their bar watching the game. Confused at first, and then a bit annoyed, then downright hostile. Maybe the Wisco alumni organizers figured a New York bar would be a good match for Brett Favre fans and Jets fans unite? It clearly wasn't working. A friend of mine got threatened for sitting on an empty stool to watch the game (which remained empty the entire time we were there as the dude watched it and we stood.) I got ice thrown at me from some 38-going-on-55 cougar with a bad perm, which actually felt kind of refreshing thanks to the sweltering heat. Even after most of the Wisco-crew departed, it was uber-crowded with zero ventilation. 

Bartenders were nice, and as accommodating as they could be for only having 2 people serving drinks. I might feel differently if this was my neighborhood dive bar, but for now I'll pass. I'm kind of more into the SF laid back vibe vs. the NY confrontational one anyway.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Ok, if you are a New York Giants or Yankees fan, you will feel right at home in this place.  My boyfriend and I love to come here and watch football.  It's packed with enthusiastic NY fans and it's usually a great time.  I don't drink 'em, but the bloody marys are supposed to be the best.  I can vouch for the seabreeze...perfectly strong.

Not a lot of seating and it can get crowded, so be prepared or go early.  The best thing about this place besides the good service, is that they actually grill out and provide free hamburgers & brats on game days.  I mean, who does that???  So cool & really good food.  

There is a $20 minimum on credit cards, but the bartendar was cool when we didn't quite hit the min.  The woman that works behind the bar is great & doesn't miss a beat.  She knows her stuff & works the whole bar so it's not terrible trying to get a drink.  Eric, behind the bar, was also great.
author: Kim D.

description:
This ain't no dive bar.  Well you might call it that if you picked out a few of the patrons when Aces has the free food out (they do take donations for the food), but they were probably there for the food.

The wife found this place and made sure that we stopped by for a drink when we were in town back in November.  The place is well appointed, has the requisite flat screens, and a full bar.  Bingo.  We sat down and immediately started talking to some of the regulars, one of whom even lived upstairs in one of the apartments.  She told us that Aces was pretty new, and that it was just remodeled when the new owners took over.  

I believe it.  In a barfly kind of way, it's pretty danged nice.  We ended up staying for almost 3 hours.  What fun.  You know it's a cool place when a local that you just met buys you a round of drinks...but then you buy the next round and the trend just keep repeating itself...and the next thing you know you're a little tipsy.

One thing I'm still not sure of (and have never seen before), was the beer fridge full of tiny Bud Lights (like Coronitas if you've seen them).  Why stock or make junior sized bottles of beer?  

The next time I'm in the city, I'm going back.
author: Eric W.

description:
A very different experience, and definitely a step away from the usual "mission" scene. A chance of scene is good sometimes, and maybe it was the crowd I was with, but I had a fun time here! 

Another typical dive bar, not too big, but big enough. They offer beer and mixed drinks all for your typical average drink prices. Plenty of seating for a bar. Awww and the bar dog-adorable! :) 

The bartender was quick to serve me, and I didn't have one problem! No waits in line for the bathroom (my kind of bar). Plus there's a hidden bathroom, well it's not labeled. 

I had a fun time, and dragged myself out the bar and onto the next....
author: Catherine O.

description:
As another Ace's "barfly" or "regular" i would like to refute Nicole's review.  It's one thing to go to a bar and enjoy watching your team play with a bunch of people from the tri-state area.  It is another to piss off people left and right, be politely told to stop her actions and than step them up.  

While Ace's is a Giants bar, we have many football fans who show up here, and they are all welcomed and we all root for them, as long as the G-men aren't playing them.  The fact is, and I have heard this from many people, nicole is a bar whore who has been 86'ed from several bars before this.  Nothing new.  

As far as the owner, Scotty, he is very generous, and looks out for the people in his bar.  What would you do, anger a regular or placate someone who was rooting for the bucs last year?  He looks out for his people and we look after him.  


I have lived in many areas of the country but Ace's is a little slice of New York on the west coast.  I'll see y'all on sunday
author: matt E.

description: Good sports bar- it is more reminiscient of a place you would find in NY or DC. When I went, it was packed with Wisconsin fans. Who would think a middle of the road time would have such a following here in SF. Anwyay, I will return here, preferably without all the Wisconsin people in the place...
author: Jim B.

description:
Went here last night to watch the Sox-Yankees game. I was not the only Sox fan in the place, and everyone was really friendly and nice to us.
Lots of good banter, easy going staff. We asked where we could get a bite to eat and Eric steered us towards the nearby deli, but also mentioned they had menus if we wanted to order something.
Great place.
The Sox-Yankees rivalry was friendly and at the end of the night people wished us a good night. We'll definitely be back.
Oh, and this place is no dive! It's very clean.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Ace's is simple. So is this review. Ace's has cheap booze. It opens early. It is very clean. It is a "New York" bar. It is never crowded. Ace's has free food. Ace's has nice people. They like to watch sports.

Ace's: An uncomplicated bar for an uncomplicated man.
author: Katie H.

description:
This place definitely deserves an awesome yelp review from me.

I was going to have my birthday party at Minx down the street, but they were closed for a private event! I had even checked their website before making birthday plans and there was nothing about Minx being closed that night. Grrr.

So I wandered down the street looking for another bar nearby, and stumbled across Ace's. The man at the front door (I think his name was Kevin) was sympathetic to my story, and suggested that I have the party at Ace's instead. He even offered the large booth area for me and my friends. Score!

While I waited, Kevin introduced me to the bartender, whose name I think was Danielle. She was really nice and made me a drink while I sent a mass text to my friends telling them about the party location switch.

I liked the atmosphere a lot, the jukebox was full of ACDCtasticness, and the staff were all laid back and friendly. So thank you Ace's for making my birthday a blast and I will be back soon!
author: Leslie C.

description:
One of the best bars I've ever known. 

Ace's:
- is where I first tasted Fernet.
- has become my favorite place to consume Fernet.
- pours the largest, over-the-brim shots of Fernet anywhere.
- has excellent bartenders that know your name and take good care of you.
- has the best and most cleanest bathrooms you'll find anywhere.
- has been a great place for me and/or my wife to meet lots of interesting people from SF and beyond.
- is where I left my cell phone one night and was still able to retrieve it two days later.
- is where I've written some of the best parts of my book.
- what the Stein Club was in Atlanta. That says a lot.
author: Derek R.

description:
Why?
Am I here?
Am I sober and here?

Can someone help me...please!

Once you do get a drink and promptly order 5 more then you are having a good time.

Why? 
Am I here again?
author: Adrienne P.

description: What can I say, this place rocks! My friend and I went up to SF for a girls weekend and stumbled across this gem which was walking distance from our hotel (Hotel Carlton). The staff and owners are the friendliest around, making you feel at home and giving that Cheers vibe "where everybody knows your name." There is a ton of memorabilia to look at, great (and cheap!) drinks, and the beer comes served in koozies! I recommend this bar any time, but it's especially fun on Sundays for football and "half-time dance parties". J Luke, Fidel, and Tommy all rock behind the bar! Can't wait to go back for a visit.
author: Andria B.

description:
off the back, I'd like to give it up to these guys  for hosting one of the best Sunday morning football gatherings at a bar that I've ever attended!!!!  cheap beer specials, free BBQ, and an absence of 49er fans (that's a good thing!)  the majority of the crowd are east coast football fans, but for the most part they kept it pretty civilized for being a first timer.  I've been looking for a a place to catch a game or two of football ever since I've moved to the city and i gotta' say that this is it for me!

they also get the early bird award for opening their establishment @ 6:00am for those of us that don't mind a drink or two.. or three or more before 12:00pm!  just remember to tip the chef when filling up on the free BBQ spread that they lay out for the early morning revelers!!!!  they have definitely earned their 5 stars in my book!



***ursa major***
author: Michael M.

description:
After exploring the city for a few hours on foot, we sat down at Ace's to have a beverage.  Six hours later, we ended up leaving.  The bartender introduced us to fernet and Magner's (a cider beer) while putting up with our general tipsiness, accidental drink spilling, and MegaTouch playing.  A bit out of hand for a Labor Day, I know.  

This bar is atypical of what I would expect to find in the area, but that's what makes it special.  By special, I mean that it would be my preferred establishment if I lived within 2 miles of it.  It's dark, but not too dark, loud, but not too loud, friendly, but not too friendly.  

Oh, and the bartender owned some guy for not saying excuse me to us while he was trying to pick change off the ground.  "Do they know how to say 'Excuse me?' where you're from?"
author: Marc A.

description: If you're looking for a sports bar, this is the place to go! I always describe it as "Cheers" where everyone knows your name. Everyone is very laid back, chill, and helpful/nice. This is a great place to come to get a drink and watch a game.
author: Lo L.

description: This place is awesome!! Come here! Our bartender was freindly. Talkative and very nice. Totally worth leaving the other bar we were at to come here. Not a huge selection but reasonable prices.
author: L. ..

description:
I love this F*ing place.  

The only reason I can't give it five stars is because I am not prone to hyperbole; therefore, it is extremely rare that business X will have the best Y.

Anyway, Ace's delivers the goods.  This is a fun place to take over with your group of friends, a fun place to have a drink alone, a fun place to catch a game on any one of the 6 wide-screen plasmas, a fun out of the way place to take a date, a fun place to get completely sloshed, etc. etc.  The theme here: this is a fun place.  

The bartenders are great, the scene is as iconoclastic as it gets, the jukebox is excellent (though thankfully shut-off during important NY Giants football and NY Yankees baseball games), and the drinks are strong.  What else do you need in a watering hole?

Note: by all accounts this may feel like a "locals" establishment, however it lacks the inherent pretensions marred by other "locals" hang-outs.  You will feel right at home with the friendly clientele in the bar, the bar's inviting lighting and cleanliness, not-too-loud music, and fun scene.

Sidebar: this is a phenomenal place to catch a NY Yankees game or a NY Giants game.  This place is chock full of REAL NYG and NYY fans who know their shit and like to watch games.  If you are a fan, I can't speak highly enough about this place.  The enormous oversized New York Yankees sign in the window gives it away.
author: Cody K.

description:
I was in SF on business and staying at a crappy hotel up the street. Needing a place to hang on a Tuesday night (since the room was so bad), I wandered into Ace's. I sat down and introduced myself to the bartender. He said, "Hi, I'm Tommy" in a solid NY accent. Even though I'm from Chicago, I felt like I was at a pub down the street from my house. You can tell the place had a lot of regulars, but I had a great time talking with people.

I ended up back in there the next night. Will was bartending and he was just a solid as Tommy. A good place with good prices on drinks. I will go out of my way to go there next time I'm in town.

Also, a solid, diverse selection on the jukebox.
author: Woody M.

description: This is the spot to watch Sunday NFL Ticket and grub on some bomb ass BBQ. MAKE SURE YOU TIP THE COOK!!! Bunch of NY fans, but its all good. You gotta remind them that they are in the Bay sometimes. All in good fun.
author: Noel E.

description:
If this were my neighborhood, Aces would be my neighborhood pub.

This is a very adult place, not trendy.  In the style of a dive bar -- dark, simple, basic -- but much too clean and pretty to be a dive.  Instead of a naked woman or velvet elvis painting above the bar there's a downward tilting mirror so you don't even have to get up or turn your head to check people out.

There's a heavy deck-of-cards theme and that's well done with the artwork, tee shirts, card suits stained into cement floors.  Four or more flat screen TVs in a small room.

Dinks are decent and on the inexpensive and largish side, alcohol and beer selection is SF basic (which would make it the best bar in most other towns).

Best of all they open up at 6AM so you can get your morning drunk started early.
author: Gil S.

description:
They can hang a hundred TV's and play all different sports from around the country, they can have comfortable seats and serve tall boys in the can (really without you asking for it), they can play very, very good music on the juke or whoever's iPod happens to be running things, but this bar really stands apart for one reason.

The bartenders.

Tommy (and crew - apologies for not knowing all of your names) busts his ass and never looks like he's doing anything other than enjoying the party with you.  They have to talk to some of the interesting characters that come in, they have to break up fights, and they have to drink when their compadres serve them shots, and yet they're always in good moods and really quite fast to get you a drink.

Ace's rocks.
author: Tim K.

description:
Stopped by with friends to watch the Giants game on a Monday night.  Light crowd (it was Monday) but relaxed people.  Bartenders were fast and friendly.  The drinks are cheap; no food, but they allow you to bring in or have it delivered.  Also, a plus that it is dog friendly as nothing says relaxing at the bar more than a cold beer and a dog sitting next to the stool.

As a New York transplant, it was nice to see a little NYC in SF.  The seats from Yankee stadium are a fun touch.

Summary:  nice dive bar with cheap booze; good place to watch a game.

As a side note, a lot of the girls in the group thought the bartender was hot, so all you ladies with bartender fantasies, this may be the place for you.
author: Michael C.

description: My boyfriend and I randomly stopped in Ace's for a drink after walking around all day. Colin was super friendly! We had a great time!
author: MrsCynthia M.

description:
Here's yet another comment on Nicole's negative review of one of my favorite places in SF. Nicole has completely fabricated and misconstrued her experiences at Aces.
The "barflies" (of which I happily consider myself one) are some of the most respectful and stand-up individuals I know. Like Matt said, fans of other football teams come in and are also respected completely.

Scotty is a stand-up manager/owner and runs a great business and does whatever he can for his employees and customers. The only reason Nicole was 86ed is because she just didn't know how to step down and stop getting into people's business (even after being told to her face that she has to just chill out and walk away from the scenes that SHE started). 

I came into Aces with a fellow Giants fan and was immediately accepted and treated like an equal by the staff and the regulars. But you don't have to be a G-Men fan to be treated well. You just have to be a decent human being and you'll be recognized and treated as a friend.
author: Ayla G.

description: I used to get drunk here and think it was funny to steal beer cozies. I would like to say I'm sorry, Ace's.
author: carrie c.

description:
Disclosures first - I am an Orioles fan (maybe the only Orioles fan in SF) and so in good conscience can never give full points to a bar full of the self-righteous, baseball buying, band wagon jumping mob that are Yankee fans. 

This place is simply one of the best spots to watch a game in SF. Bartenders are cool and attentive, serve stiff drinks quickly and have a full selection of the cheap beers in buckets that I love and expect from a bar that I'm going to see a game in. Plenty of TVs and free bbq on Sundays can't be beat. I wish it was closer to where I lived, but am always happy to make the trek out there.
author: Pierre C.

description: No-frills place with $3 beers every night.  The barkeeps are always exceptionally nice.  It's a NY bar, so expect those teams to be on the TVs.
author: Sean C.

description: Went on Sunday in the early afternoon. I love that they open at 6am. $3.00 miller high life is proper. Windows open facing the street. Nice spot to watch sports. Word.
author: Jason S.

description: New York giants bar 3 dolla can beers sounds good to me
author: Kevin A.

description:
I've been here a couple times as it was recommended as an interesting place to watch football by some fellow Niner fans.  I only come here on Sundays for football, so I have no idea how this place is otherwise.

I'll usually roll in around 9-ish on Sunday, and get started with their $2 16 oz Buds/Bud Lights.  Drinking these makes the pre-game shows infinitely more tolerable (unless Steve Young is on...but it's usually Bradshaw or Berman annoying the shit out of everyone).  At this point, my day is feeling pretty good, since getting drunk while other people are at church is always a fine way to start a day.

There are two crowds that show up at the bar.  When I get there, there is the group of people who are hung over from the night before, and stumble in to get a couple Bloody Mary's, or a real drink if they are alcoholics.  These people are interesting, but I'm not drunk enough to really talk to them for more than 5 minutes before I want to run away (you know what I'm talking about).

The football crowd will start to filter in around 10:30 (besides the hardcore fans who have to watch the early kickoff).  The football crowd here is really excellent.  A variety of knowledgeable fans, associated with different teams.  They are friendly, can talk good football, and are just fun to watch games with.

The bartenders are also really solid.  They make sure you got your drink supplied, and they can talk football too!  I made the mistake of doubting one of the female bartenders fan-dom, and she owned with some Bronco trivia knowledge.  So respect to her, and the other bartenders.

There is also free BBQ on Sundays, which isn't that great...but it is free.  I haven't eaten anything off the menu, but...that isn't why I come here.

I come here to get drunk on the cheap, watch Sunday Ticket, and hang out with fun NFL fans.  What more can anyone ask for?

I'll see you all there in September!
author: Robert S.

description: My friend and I were bar hopping around this neighborhood, she had to pee, we figured we get one drink while she peed and we'd move on, go get some food, and see where the night takes us.  It looks like a sports bar, so probably not our favorite kind of place, but we do like sort of divey places and good bartenders, so who knows?  The bartender was friendly, got our drinks right away, asked for our ids very politely.  It made me laugh that my friend called the bartender "Hey cute bartender" to his face when she asked him for some waters.  If we ever go back I think we should never learn his real name, it will forever just be "Cute Bartender".
author: Muriel D.

description: Great dive bar for Wisconsin Badgers and NY Yankees games.
author: Joshua S.

description:
YES aces.

YES for having a rad jukebox
YES for allowing us to take over your bar every time the Wisconsin Badgers play a football or basketball game
YES for having a bitchin 3rd anniversary party
YES for scotty the super fun owner
YES for PHOTO HUNT
YES for strong, reasonably priced drinks
author: Brooke M.

description: I heard about Ace's from my father who heard it mentioned on Q104.3, a classic rock station out of NYC. It was the week before the Giants-Niners playoff game in San Fran and two weeks before he and I would fly out there to surprise my aunt for her 70th birthday. We made it a point to go here the night we flew in, so after getting settled at our hotel, we grabbed a cab and went over for a few beers. I was expecting it to be bigger, but its smaller size grew on me. I must say that I didn't really feel "at home" at the New York themed bar, but I felt very comfortable nonetheless.  There were mostly locals there it seemed and the bartender was actually from Boston, with an obvious accent, which was, of course, ironic. The bar itself is "L" shaped and small but there weren't many people there that night so we found spots right away, probably because it was pretty early and on a Thursday. Beer selection was great, spirits stock looked well kept, and after a beer or two we walked down the road a bit to Pearl's Deluxe Burgers, on a recommendation from our friend from Boston.
author: Kevin L.

description: This place is pretty cool. It's very diverse and everyone is very friendly. The prices are also a great thing and on the cheaper side. They have a TV on about every wall and angle. Great place to just come and hang out.
author: Toby H.

description:
A dark maroon interior with male-centric decor, Adequate TV's for sports, and copious windows facing the street give Ace's a somewhat masculine yet non-hostile ambiance. The crowd is more Tender-nob than Nob Hill, and the vibe is distinctly neighborhood-pub rather than dress-up-club. Wall decor is largely forgettable, save a single painting titled "Scared money never wins".  Four-buck Beers are reasonably priced, and the bar dishes out complementary peanuts.

Barry Bonds smacked number 715 over the center-field fence as I sat  sipping a pint at Ace's.  An older couple and six middle aged guys were hanging out.  There was minimal clapping and celebration followed by a long debate about the area of the stadium where number 715 landed.  Everyone had an opinion....nobody was right.  I popped by after work one day when the Yankees were playing the Red Sox.  Yankees fans were the rule....Boston fans were the exception.

An interesting but little discussed feature of Ace's is the long, narrow mirror against the wall in back of the bar.  It's tilted downwards so that anyone in the place can check out most of the bar without turning their heads.  It makes for an interesting flirt.  Not only you can check out a table of ladies in the back by glancing at the mirror....you can meet eyes with them when they do the same.  It's an interesting feature that everyone thinks is their own little secret....but it isn't.

It's a slightly awkward environment for one-time visitors, as the regulars-centric crowd can someties take a few visits to break into.  And while it's not really of a destination bar, it's definitely one to check out if you're moving into the hood and looking for a local hangout.
author: Mike W.

description:
Caveat: I can only comment on a Sunday morning last month for a World Cup game, so it might not apply to other times. 

The best of a New York City neighborhood bar (some regulars have a bit of an edge) and a Wisconsin dive bar with friendly patrons, attentive bar tenders, and some proletarian beer choices.  

Makes sense, I hear one owner is from Wisco and the other from NYC.  My only suggestion to the owner is bring out bucky and the pin-up girls a little more on par with NY teams.
author: Pete W.

description: came here after the big win on 1/22/12 !! superbowl - did a cross country tour all the way from nyc to watch the giants beat the 49r's !! best celebration ever !!
author: Kev Z.

description:
Yet again another place you'll often find me in.  I pass by it every night after work, it opens at 6am everyday, Clams lives across the street, and....well shit, it serves booze.  Just my kind of place for *almost* round-the-clock drinking.  There's nothing fancy about this place, it doesn't have a notable juke-box, and the bartenders are just bartenders.  
The thing that makes this place so awesome is the people watching.  Not just inside the bar (I mean, really, people who are at a bar at 6am getting trashed), but outside the bar as well!  Crazy homeless people, people passing by on the 2,3,4 bus lines, cute Academy of Art girls...i've spent hours sipping beer and staring out the window being utterly amused the entire time.  And honestly, what's better then watching the world go by then watching the world go by with beer goggles on!
author: Zev K.

description:
New York Giants Games,
I need another Bloody,
Meat smokes on the grill.
author: Brian J.

description: hey douchebags! all welcome! i live a block away, and went in here before a chili cook off they were having while waiting for my laundry to finish- They can't handle a drinker- go down to polk st- this bar is TIRED, and never try the chili--- i saw the grossness while it set up the poopcrockpots.
author: Gabriel F.

description: A little cramped, but a great place to watch a NY giants game in the city.
author: Chris K.

description:
I've been twice for NY Giants games and it's awesome.  Very clean for what's considered a dive-bar.  Cheap drinks, good crowd, nice staff, and free freaking barbecue on Sundays.  And I got to watch the Giants beat the hell out of someone while sitting in a seat from Shea Stadium.  

It was a little hard to leave.

Do leave some cash in the BBQ tip-jar though.
author: Scott B.

description:
So Ace's is nothing special - folks come here for its dive bar quality.  The staff is always very outgoing and super nice to the patrons.    The place is generally good for the mad-dash-before-last-call crowd.  My friends and I have usually had a "not bad time" - knowing what we're going to get with this place.  

However, I was irritated this last time after reviewing my bank statement and noticing that Ace's had over charged my card.  The receipt I signed was for $20.  I laid $5 cash tip on the counter after signing the check... only to find that the staff took the tip and charged my card an additional $5.  

Greedy and tacky.  

Way to go guys.
author: Tony Y.

description: Called ahead to find out if they were going to have the Badgers' game on today, and they said yes. I arrived, only to get some serious attitude from the bartender. He said that they absolutely weren't showing the Badgers and instead the Giants. Not only did he lie, but he was rude about it. No excuse.
author: Babs J.

description: This place is a joke.. Seems like good prices and want business but if you're not from the east coast... Shit out of luck... Don't even try. They'll just roll their eyes at you when you ask for a drink and be lazy getting back to you...  On the other hand.... If you like feeling like robin Williams in good will hunting... This is your place.
author: Julie M.

description: Amazing bartenders here. I've never seen the place so crowded. Granted it was the world cup final. The place was packed, it kinda had a stank to it...maybe they should have fired up the BBQ! Overall a great time, a stiff drink, and later on in the afternoon $3 bud light tall boys! They have authentic stadium seats, and a regular they call Mr.Miyagi. I kinda forgot for a sec that I wasn't in NYC. Lot's of T.V's for watching and the bus stops riiight outside. Local's only ;P
author: Marianne s.

description: Ace's is a great bar with friendly and cool bartenders and a fun crowd.  A great local hangout and also a great hangout for travelers who tend to pop in from time to time.  Ask for the Star Trek!!!!! drink.
author: T D.

description: There's nothing wrong with Ace's. You can give them money and they'll give you alcohol. They do this quickly and cheerfully. This is all I really ask for from a bar.
author: matthew r.

description: Bartender is super bad ass and the drinks are reasonably priced...highly recommend for a late night beverage!
author: Andrew M.

description: Came here for a Bay Area Badgers event and loved it.  The drinks are incredibly cheap, and really good!  For such a tiny place, they had a good selection of booze.  The only downside was the minimum $20 credit card requirement.  With such cheap drinks, that's hard to do!
author: Rachael S.

description: This rating goes for watching NY sports here.  Great NY crowd shows up for the games, and $3 tall boy bud/bud lights are always flowing.  Bunch of tv's, not too many seats but if you really want them just show up early.  Bartenders are on their game, and they have a free bbq for football games.
author: William B.

description:
never been to a bar nyc bar, but i'm guessing this is what its suppose to look like?

aces-an sf bar with qualities of a nyc bar is what they aim for.  great drinks at semi-affordable prices.  my friend amanda and i always go late night, so i'm not too sure what they're happy hour prices are...if they even offer it.

drinks-good, they definitely pork it.  after one double shot of jamison and coke, i'm pretty much feeling the effects of it.  

music could be better, but other than that, four of out five stars.
author: Armando B.

description: First my complaints. Minus 1/2 star for televisions being mounted so high above the bar - my neck is killing me today. Minus 1/2 star for the fact that this is a NYC loyal establishment - I am from Boston. Now the very good. The bar is clean and warm. The staff was super friendly. Great 90's rock cranking all night. Ice cold inexpensive beers. This is a great place. Keep my stool warm cuz I am heading back soon.
author: William M.

description: ive walked by this  place a million times and everytime i try to find a bar on my yelp app this is one of the top picks. the first time i came in i saw the baseball seats. kinda cool and def a sign of a good sports bar. there is a $20 min for credit cards. ive only been once and it was a monday night to watch the giants spank the rockies. it was one of most lively bars playing the game. the bartenders are really nice and take the time to talk to you and get to know you. other bars they are just there to make sure you dont reach behind and create your own all you can drink buffet. i havent been on a weekend or during a major sporting event but it seems like a good place to be.
author: Ashley H.

description: Last time I was here some guys from Iceland were buying me shots of Jagermeister. Word.
author: Braden B.

description: Best place in the city to pick tup two Irish lads at 8:00 in the morning and have them tell you that you can't drink for shit.  I'm slightly ashamed to say that this actualy happened to me.
author: Coco D.

description: Drinking at 6 a.m, NOT at the Endup or my home, has never been better. I love you, Bartender Nicole...thanks for putting up with our crap and making the best bloody mary I've ever had :)
author: Autumn K.

description: Mon-Sun 6 a.m. - 2 a.m.....what more do you need to know. I have never made it here for opening drinks but know it has been the go to place for friends when the party keeps on keepin on. It's a neighborhood sports bar with a staff that will greet you with a hand shake and a cold beer.
author: David H.

description: Probably my new favorite spot!  The bartenders were awesome, friendly, talkative and just overall great.  The set up is perfect to go to and have a few beers, and the music was awesome.  I will definitely be back soon.
author: Molly H.

description:
nice dark bar with ok drinks. 
friendly  bartenders.
author: Jacquelyne M.

description: Wait- I wanted to leave NO stars. There is nothing "local", "friendly neighborhood", or cool about this place. I can't even call it a bar really. Felt like a basement full of guys who had hopes of being cops once but were too stupid  to get in to the academy and now live thier lives in this joint drinking beers from buckets...yes, there were buckets of beer on the bar, (can't be bothered to order from the bartender more than once I guess).I mean he was an ass- so I guess maybe it's good idea not to have to talk to him more than once... and I don't want a 3-ring circus greeting me while I walk into a bar- far from it- but the feeling my friends and I  got as we walked in was more of the "get the fuck out" vibe. Well and we did after our one drink and we'll never return- which I guess makes both us and the people at Aces very happy.
author: lisa t.

description: 2.75 stars.  Potential for the full 3 if I return.  The bartender was friendly and cute and fun, but the rest of the clientelle - not so much.  I liked the fact that on a friday night it wasn't crowded at all, but really, it was almost too empty.  They serve jaegermeister and amstels so I really can't complain too much.  I might come back here if in this 'hood again.
author: Angie C.

description: Dice games, uno, beer coozies... the most perfect dive bar EVUR!
author: Rada I.

description:
uh yeah I wanted a bloody mary
and yeah she gave it to me,

and it was good.  The blonde bartender was probably the nicest I've ever had.  Well... I didn't HAVE her but she did serve me a delicious BM.  I wonder if she was german.  unfortunate initials for something soo tasty. never mind.
  This isn't in my hood at all but I feel like I want to go back.  oh yeah, and the dummy at the door had very nice dog that was fun to pet.
author: Boiled H.

description: Disclaimer: I only come here to watch FC Barcelona Games.   But just for the fact that they have GolTV and usually enough TV's to put on an often unappreciated sport  in the US- I give them 5 stars.
author: Robert M.

description:
Ace's is a quintessential neighborhood bar... not a dive bar.  It's a bit too nice and clean to be a dive bar.  

The bartenders are friendly, and very cool.  I think at least a couple of them are from New York, and they know how to spice up a conversation.  I never thought a NY accent could be charming, but it is if the person has something funny to say.

They have a good selection of booze and can make most anything.  Also cool is the front entrance with a split door that allows fresh air to get into the bar without leaving the entire door open.

It's also a dog-friendly bar, and we've seen some very cute, well-mannered dogs here.

Parking is basically non-existent around here.  The neighborhood itself is what a lot of locals like to call "The Tender-Nob", being right at the transition point of Nob Hill and the Tenderloin.
author: Dave N.

description: I seriously like this place.  It's just a very small place,  not really many women, but it's got a great vibe, New York atmosphere, the owner is very friendly and down to earth.  They set up free food for the National Championship game Oregon-Auburn.  Authentic Yankee seats, great jukebox.  If you appreciate the East Coast character, this is the spot.
author: Jason R.

description: This is the best place to watch sports especially during football season. They have really cheap beer and someone is always firin up some heavy meat on the grill outside. Everyone in here is pretty much a regular during football. It's ok to watch the niners lose here because the guy sitting next to you feels the same "C'mon, just make a play" sadness that hits a true fan. So you won't be alone. The bartenders are just good buds. Good vibe in here and every game on the tv's.
author: Ash D.

description: One of my favorite bars to hit up, esp during the weekdays.  So it's kinda difficult to review this bar since I go there most of the time.  My girls and I go there every so often.  Despite all that, I love their drinks.  They pour a good amount of Alchy and they have cool bartenders.  Usually when I go there I  order a shot of Grey goose and it's always filled up.  Join me and my girls there.  If you catch us your pretty lucky because we usually go there once or twice a week.
author: Tiffany D.

description: A little bit farther than my usual neighborhood bars but worth the walk. Mellow, cheap drinks and nice bartenders. Large enough to bring a large group of friends and totally cool patrons. If you are in the neighborhood you should definitely stop on by.
author: Heather L.

description:
First of all, I am a little disappointed in the fact that Ace's category is under Dive Bar. In my opinion, it is far from a dive bar... have you been to R Bar? 
Best bartenders ever (besides GAMH)! Good prices, big TV's, clean bathrooms, and my little pup can come hang out with us (although I'm still upset he can go behind the bar, and I can't).
Plus I live in the beginning of the loin/lowest section of nob hill, and it's nice to go 3 blocks and be at a great bar in a great area, not just another Koko Cocktail or Whiskey Thieves (I do however like the Thieves). 
All in all, if you are in the lower nob-hill area, and don't know where to go... just walk past R Bar, Lush Lounge, Vertigo and all the other Polk St. hang outs, and cruise to Hyde and Sutter where you'll have a much better time and you don't have to co-habitat the bar with the Marina crowd who think they are "so cool " for hanging out in the loin.
author: Jessica O.

description:
I love Ace's. I am from the NJ/NY area originally and when it came time to find a place that played Giants games (those early am ones on Sunday), some bartenders suggested I go to Ace's because it was a "new York bar" (I swear San Francisco is so weird with that shit). Anyways like a dummy I didn't go during football season and instead waited 7 months to check it out. I was missing out!

First, it's got people in it on weekdays which is great because it reminded me of New York and thats a change from sleepy weeknight bars in SF. Secondly, the bartenders are super friendly and chill, no attitude and fun to talk to. Lastly, its fuckin cheap! We drank many many beers and Jamesons and the bill was $30 (2 people at least 4 drinks each). 

I won't even take a point off for lack of food, because you can order in if you want!
author: Sam H.

description:
A wander around San Francisco on a Sunday night ended with a conversation that went something like. "Want to find a bar?" "Ok, check Yelp." Aces was close and seemed to fit the bill. However I have no idea what a "NY Bar" is and I've been to plenty of bars in NY.

Dark, moody, steady stream of locals and a bartender who was genuinely cool. None of the fake niceness that you sometimes get. Either he was really that cool or a great actor, either way worth a nice tip. This bar was a winner for me. Oh and 3 makers/cokes, 2 vodak redbulls for $30?! I'm coming back tonight. One last thing...I could have sworn I saw a friendly canine tucked away in a corner but I think I must have been seeing things. Add a few naked women and this could possibly be the greatest place I have ever been.
author: Jeremy H.

description: I first came here because I knew the bartenders/owners from their days in North Beach.  They did a terrific job renovating the place and I can honestly say that its now one of the nicer bars in which one can watch a game in the City. The bartenders are New York guys, so its a good spot to go if you're a Yankee fan (but don't fret, Red Sox Nation -- the guys who work down the street at R Bar are regulars here.  All are welcome).  Be sure to grab a bucket of the Budweiser minis... it's the only way to go.
author: Andrew E.

description: Another great place in SF. No bs, no mean people, no kidding. Head there for a little fresh air as the haze of seeandbeseen types clouds your vision...
author: David R.

description: skrewdriver on jukebox. now thats said, being in sf you cant really look further. if anyone can show us a more blue collar place to sink pints please show/tell me.
author: aidan m.

description: Among the mix of snob hill folks & bums in the loin lies Aces. This is a great, unpretentious bar that's a perfect place to grab a drink & watch a game. Now I would never advertise that I'm a die hard Red-Sox fan, as this is a NY bar, but it's still a pretty chill place to hang out & converse with friends over a game. Decent beer selection & it's never too crowded.
author: Dan C.

description: Great jukebox, close to my apartment, AND two adorable canines in residence? Fabulous.
author: Noelle Q.

description: I love me my Aces: coolest bartenders/owners in the city, NFL Ticket and free bar-b-que on Sundays AND it's in my 'hood.  Can you beat that?  I don't think so.
author: Kate C.

description: Went here after gettin a burger to watch some playoff basketball, great little place (which is dog friendly).  Bartender was nice and friendly, and overall I think I'd highly recommend this place for an unpretentious beer and some good times with the guys.
author: Mike A.

description: This bar was great.  The bartendar made my drink nice and strong and the people there were more.....not hipsters.  The bathrooms were decent for a dive bar and there was a cute bulldog in there just hanging out.  This is a bar I would go to again.
author: Erica N.

description: Tommy is hot and he makes one mean Bloody Mary!
author: lisa v.

description: ACE'S is sooo much fun! If you love a laid back place, with a lot of really fun people this is definitely the place to go. Megan is a great bartender and a total blast, Tommy is also great and made me the best shot I have ever taken, something with the new coffee patron....delicious everyone should get one! Ace's Friday Nights is a definite hot spot!
author: Carlotta W.

description: Went there for some beers for March Madness; nice neighborhood bar that turned out to be a huge Wisconsin fan hangout, or at least for that evening.   Good place for watching sports, and just hanging out, but no food, in case you were wondering.
author: Graham B.

description: This in one of my favorite places to go in the city. Good people, friendly people and great aesthetics.
author: John B.

description: I love this bar. Even though it's always empty. So why am I only giving it 3 stars? Because I want it to continue to be exactly as it is! You can always go here when other places are packed, when you want to sit down and talk, when you want to chat with a bartender. Or with a local weirdo. Or with who ever happen to be in there. Aces might be the friendliest bar in the city. Hands down.
author: Magnus F.

description: DON'T PASS THIS ALONG TO TOO MANY PEOPLE!!!!  Scott the owner said hit up aces, ask for Eric and he will be more than happy to turn the UFC fights on.....Let me back track....The Pub at fishermans wharf is the same owner as aces.  Not UFC fights at the pub, so hit aces.... SO, we walked for the pub (bad idea, cause its far and up hill), a slight "buzz" was very helpful tho.  Walk in, its a local bar, not busy, B line to the bar, which is 6 steps from the front door, as for my guy Eric.  Give him the whole story about pub, fight, scott...blah blah blah.  He grabs the remote and puts the fights on.  After 2-4-5-7 drinks the night was perfect.  After my buddy wins his fight, we close out our tab, which was VERY VERY LOW considering the amount of drinks we had consumed, and called it a night at ACES.  Total local dive bar.  Don't expect the tourist, the clean cut bankers, just expect people looking to watch the games, have a few drinks and enjoy the atmosphere.  BUT PLEASE.......DONT RUIN THIS SPOT.......KEEP IT QUIET!!!!!!
author: Rich F.

description: like Ace's/dark with a great jukebox.  love a good dive...fun staff/fun people and good  atmosphere.
author: william b.

description: how did i end up in a corner dive bar in the seedy part of town on a monday night? Well let me explain. it all started out at the ballpark. I attended a Giants game with my rowdy friends from softball, brian and mike. the Giants started out strong, and a win seemed promising. my friend brian is an excellent heckler. So good in fact, it prompted about 20 other guys around us to start yelling too. poor Lee (the Brewers leftfielder) took quite a beating. thankfully he had a sense of humor because he kept turning around and laughing. in a bad twist of fate though, things got ugly fast and the Giants lost 10-1 (ouch) to the Brewers. despite the loss, we were in great spirits after the game. we wanted to go out so we cruised around. the idea was to corrupt a new place.....and we found Aces. its far from being in a desirable area and its definitely not fancy. the crowd inside was, well..... interesting. but it all worked.... i found myself having a great time here. by the end of the night the whole bar was chatting together like longtime friends over a blaring jukebox. major bonus feature, the bathroom is really clean! yep, sparkling and lemon scented. the bartender being from Boston knew exactly how to keep the bar happy and the drinks flowing. so upon leaving we agreed the final consensus was good. i was impressed and plan on coming back. fun times, good bar.
author: Michelle I.

description: this bar is full of some of the biggest ass holes i've ever encountered. i am a huge fan of "dive bars" and therefore included this one in a bar crawl 17 of us went on last saturday.  its a loud, dark, chaotic bar and someone brought their dog. this poor thing was skulking around looking for an exit. its tail was tucked under, ears back, head low...the poor thing was frightened and confused. the 'owner' of the dog, some scummy guy, seems to be so massively insecure that he has to tote around a poor animal for company. we left the bar and i will never go back to an establishment that condones animal abuse. it was really hard to enjoy our buzz while watching this dog clearly suffer
author: A.c. D.

description: Fantastic place!!  The staff is fabulous!!  This is a place for real drinkers unlike hundreds of other bars in the city.   It's simple:  you come here if you want to be around good company and get inebriated.  I once did a shot of Cazadores with Dan Patrick here.  He quit ESPN the next day.
author: Marko C.

description: This bar is so damn good that I moved in above it! Okay... that's an exaggeration... but it is my favorite bar, and I do live above it now. The drinks are hella good. Their long island iced tea is untouchable. The bartenders are a bunch of new yorkers... they're good people, but they are New Yorkers. I'm not much of a sports fan, but if you were you'd love this place. The bar gets packed, drunk, and loud. There is an interesting mix of people at this bar; they are difficult to summarize. The bar opens at seven AM (hellz yes!), so there are a lot of older (not old, I mean 40-50's) people that came to drink like rats. None of them are really mean. Then, about sixty percent of the people there are in their twenties, but they tend to be toward the top percentile of partyers. I saw a girl drunkenly dancing and kicking on a table here at 4:30 once. I usually can't leave the bar myself without at least two drinks... but usually like 5 drinks. The jukebox is kickass, with lots of great rock songs from Metallica to Cake to Dropkick Murphys. The prices are fair for a heavy, king-in-the-face, but delicious cocktail. Go here. Don't go where you think you should go instead. Go here.
author: Alexander W.

description: Free BBQ on Sundays and tons of Yankee fans!
author: Chris C.

description: Ace's is one of the many neighborhood bars in my area, but by far my favorite! Unlike most venues, the owner Scott actually shows up at the bar a few times a week to greet and visits with guests! Tommy and Danielle are awesome bartenders and always make you feel welcome. Wednesday nights they hook up a Wii, allowing customers to play and encouraging mingling within various groups of patrons. On warm Sunday San Francisco days they barbeque food outside for guests FREE; nothing beats sports on the tube, bbq, and an ice cold beer! Prices here are great ($2 Buds/Bud Lights on Sundays) and mixed drinks are always well poured. No matter what night of the week, I can consistently walk into Ace's and feel completely welcome and comfortable. After the drinks get flowing, everyone from the patrons to bar staff become practically family. I would recommend this bar to anyone looking for great drinks and exceptional people to mingle with!!
author: Bri C.

description: Ace's is awesome!  I rented out the bar for my 35th and it was the perfect place.  Scott, the owner, was so helpful and accomodating.  Drinks are really reasonable, great jukebox, fantastic service.  I would recommend it for a private party or drinks any night of the week!
author: Elissa P.

description: i like this bar... but then again dirk was paying for drinks....
author: Matt N.

description: I love Ace's. The bartenders are friendly and the drinks don't break the bank. It has a neighborhood bar kind of feel. If you're looking for a fun place to hang out for a couple of hours, I would highly recommend Ace's.
author: Erin C.

description: Stopped by here for a drink with a few of my girls last night after a graduation. it was a cute little bar, extremely friendly and sweet bartender who made a kick-ass Bloody Mary! If there were a bit more people there and it was a little more lively, we would of prob stayed a little longer. But its a cool place to grab a drink and chat with locals or your friends.
author: Diana D.

description: best place in the hood! great mix of people: locals from up & down the hill. always have fun here, super-cheap drinx
author: O B.

description: it was kind of hard to concentrate on the bar itself b/c the bartender was the most beautiful man i have seen in a long time.  he was attentive and funny too!! i will go back simply to gawk at him some more.  i think his name is tommy?  muah!
author: Jessica K.
